name: linabperez_
text: Love this place!!! Doggie training is really good and professional she gives you a lot of tips with one on one classes as well. It’s also fun for the dogs and safe. Definitely worth it.

resp.text: Thank you Lina!  It was a pleasure working with you and Rachel.  :)

name: cheryl gwin
text: Great place for your doggies! Your fur babies will be well taken care of, run and play their hearts out, and have the time of their life! Whether it's for boarding or doggie day care you can't lose with Red Dog Ranch.

name: cheryl gwin
text: Best place ever for your pooch!  You can rest easy knowing your dog is in good hands when you bring them to the ranch.

name: Bretta Cagle
text: Amazing place for your dogs. Highly recommend!

resp.text: Thanks Bretta!  Sure do love having the girls stay at the Ranch 💕

name: Joe Anderson
text: What an amazing place to board your dog. Gracie's has learned to.play with other dogs by hanging out.at the ranch.

name: Eve Anderson
text: This place is unbelievably wonderful!  I am in the Shoals, AL area frequently for work.  This wonderful pupper oasis allows me to bring my sweet pup Maggie along with me.  She’s always depressed for a couple days when we return home to Chicago, because she feels so at home - as well as physically & mentally engaged at the ranch.  The owner / operator is actually a dog trainer, and I’m seeing Maggie pick up some great habits each day after her playtime.  Thank you sincerely, for all that you do for Maggie and I.

name: Eric McGee
text: Boarding without hours spent kenneled. Fields to run, pools to stay cool, and other dogs to play with. I think we missed our puppy more than she missed us!

name: Chris Whealen
text: Just an awesome experience and I know my pup had a great time. Very reasonable rates as well.

resp.text: Thanks Chris!  We really enjoyed keeping Elvis at the Ranch, and glad to hear he enjoyed himself as well. 😉

name: Misty Campbell
text: Very pleased with Frank, Jamie, and all the great people at Belle Shain!!  I contacted Frank when I was about at my wit’s end with our puppy, Cross.  He was biting/chewing excessively (on me mostly), he was unable to walk on a leash, and he was just not doing well.  Within a matter of weeks, Frank and his team have taught Cross how to behave better, he has learned commands, and he is a more pleasant dog to be around.  I can tell Cross loves being at Belle Shain, too. He enjoys playing with other dogs, running around, and swimming in the river. Definitely helpful for training and burning off all of that puppy energy!

name: Annie Summers
text: I trained my two dogs Dixie and Maddie with Frank and Jamie at Belle Shain Kennels. It has made a huge difference in how much enjoyment I get from my dogs now they will sit, heel and place. I highly recommend their training facility. My dogs love it there. I still take my  them for kenneling when I travel and day care boarding too. Frank does tune ups on Saturdays at the Woof Bar, I think that’s more tuning up the trainer than the dog🐶. Great people and wonderful property for the dogs to play.

name: Stacey Bottorff
text:
Great training and boarding program! Our dog spent about 3 months with Frank working on general obedience and then progressing from there. He is very knowledgeable and patient, incorporating training sessions with my husband and I throughout the months as well. Our dog enjoyed her time there!
During her time there our dog also required some vet attention (preexisting issue) and Frank did not hesitate to get her into his vet for care. Would definitely recommend Frank and his training program to other dog owners!

name: Daniel Campbell
text: Frank and the gang at Belle Shain are nothing short of fantastic. They are very accommodating and do a great job at a very reasonable price. Our dog was young, very energetic, and rambunctious. They are successfully turning him into a much better mannered young dog. He gets lots of exercise and loves playing with other dogs and swimming in the river (under supervision). He is excited to jump out of the truck he gets there every Monday morning and is obviously very well treated at Belle Shain. I can not recommend them enough.

name: Chase Emerson
text:
Frank and his crew were outstanding!!
They had my dog trained very quickly, and efficiently.
Not to mention they treat all the animals very well. I will use them in the future over anyone else!!

name: Kyle Maxwell
text: Frank and his crew did an amazing job training my dog and treated her very well.

name: Chris Wade
text: No other place I would take my dogs. Frank did an awesome job with both of my dogs. Use him for boarding when we go out of town. Dogs have a blast and get excited when we pull in the driveway!

name: Abigail Jackson
text: Clipper has had a blast this summer at training and boarding camp. He has learned so much and is now off leash. I have seen a total transformation in Clipper’s behavior and attitude. Frank and Staff are amazing to work with and really get to know and care about your dog. I am forever thankful for BelleShain Kennels.

name: Dana Andrews
text: The owner was very nice when talking up his services. However, after paying my deposit something unforeseen happened and I had to cancel. It had not even been 1 1/2 hours. He would not respond to my text asking for my deposit back. He never told me the deposit was non-refundable. I'm very upset by this. I could understand if it had been more than a or two, but less than two hours, and he could see the reason for cancelation was out of my control.

name: Anna Kate Ingram
text: We have 3 kids and for Christmas Santa brought us a puppy, a year later we had a giant dog that didn’t obey us and jumped on everyone. Michael leash trained him for us, also taught him to sit, stay, heel. And taught us how to continue the training. We were very pleased, after just 4 days we had a totally different dog. A year later he is a joy to walk, and will sit & stay when I need him too.

name: Michael Tarrance
text: Dropped my 6 month old son (Rottweiler) off to him a couple days ago. We were greeted with professionalism. Mr Anderson walked us through everything he was going to be doing with our boy step by step. The dogs on site were well mannered and all looked amazing. Welcoming atmosphere. Even his kids were friendly and welcoming to my kids. (They walked off and started playing Minecraft). That was the review of our drop off for personal protection training. Come back in 30-45 days and I’ll let you guys know how everything turned out.

name: eric bell
text: Best in the business. Very professional what you ask for you get. Mike is a dog whisperer for sure. I tried everything to keep my dog in the yard and he kept jumping fence. 1 day working with mike and he never left yard. Highly recommend

name: candace bartee
text: Awesome quality of service!!! I’ve never seen dogs respond the way they do after spending time with Mike. He’s patient, very responsive, will keep you informed of training, and very easy to work with. I would 110% recommend him to anyone looking for K9 coaching.

name: Rafael O'Neal
text: Mike is the best when it comes to handling dogs.  When I find my new additions to the family, Gatekeepers will be my first stop.

name: Melissa Bazzell
text: We have 2 dogs, one that can be aggressive due  to anxiety and one that is deaf. We took them to Mike and he helped us with on leash training and off leash training. He helped to “train” us as pet owners as well!  I was amazed at how quickly he was able to get our pups to do what he wanted them to do. I would highly recommend Mike!

name: Derek Mayes
text: This is my 2nd time the Gatekeepers k9 provided me with professional,  reliable, and value priced service. Brooklynn(pit bull) was having issues wanting to pull when walking her and jumping up on people. Although she was friendly.  They helped with these issues. Great job!

name: Philemon Gray
text: My German shepherd Kennel Holdip Shepherds, has been dealing and depending on Gate keepers k-9 for years now. Mike has trained over 20 dogs for us in the field personal protection , Obedience, service , and Police work . Mike is a Guru at training a dog to do anything . Mike is definitely one of the top trainers in North American . They are professional and extremely effective.

name: Nikieyva Johnson
text:
VERY PROFESSIONAL  SATISFYING RESULTS
I RECOMMEND TO ANYONE AND EVERYONE
WITH A PUP IN NEED OF TRAINING
GATEKEEPERS K9 DEFINITELY IT!
MIKE KNOWS WHAT HE IS DOING

name: Joshua Williams
text: The type of training and obedience i have seen from the dogs he has is remarkable. My father raised and trained different breeds throughout his life so i have been around dogs since before i could remember so it was very hard for me to look out to find someone to train my dogs because i was like everyone else who believed that knew it all but truthfully i dont and also dont have the time. I was invited to a training course with a German shepherd breed that had so many issues i saw from the video the owner showed me of before his training. The course showed him 20 days later and the obedience this dog showed was truly amazing. I have recently became an owner of 4 pitbulls that will definitely begin training with him as soon as they become of age. Not only is the price very reasonable but the type of advise he has provided for nutrition needs, health, and maintenance of the dogs even without them starting the training yet really speaks to his passion, drive, and character. He has earned a life long customer from me and i would recommend his training above all others. If you're reading this please look no further. You have found what your looking for in this company.

name: Garrette Rogers
text: I live in Colorado and found one of Mike's pups through a 3rd party website, Mike was very responsive and helped me with purchasing my pup.  During this covid situation it was tough getting the him out to me, flights were tough to book for shipping dogs but Mike was very diligent and finally agreed for myself to fly to Atlanta and meet so I could pick him up and drive back same day.  Mike did not hesitate and was willing to drive from Alabama to Atlanta and meet me at 130 in the morning so that I could receive my fantastic pup Ruger.  Along with meeting me he provided me with a 50lb bag of the food brand he uses (lol only needed a small bit) and a small crate if I needed it.  The professionalism he showed would make me go back to him for another pup if he ever has them in the future in a heartbeat, thanks Mike again Ruger hes been amazing.  Obedience training has went well maybe not gatekeeper9 standard but he is off leased trained by 7 months and couldn't imagine life without him.  Thanks again.

name: jonathan oswald
text: Mike Anderson is Alabama's #1 Dog Whisperer!!

name: Michael Morgan
text: A top of the line facility for the training and placement of service animals.

name: marianne mcleod
text:
This organization is a state wide nonprofit. They are the only Service Dog Organization in the state of Alabama approved by the Alabama Department of education to be in public schools throughout the state.

They provide excellent training for PTSD, Diabetic alert, Autism and mobility issues.  The staff is top notch!

name: David Blackburn
text:
Great organization!

Currently our family has "Nikki" which has been great for us! Initially she was placed with our, then 11 y/o son, for autism intervention. Ashley remained in contact with us for updates on his and Nikki's bonding process. Unfortunately, the lack of a bond meant Nikki was not the correct match. The organization took Nikki back to give additional training based on our conversations, and recommendations.

Next, Nikki returned to our family because she had built a decent bond with our daughter during her initial placement. Nikki is doing very well with our 14 y/o daughter, and has helped her in many ways. Her training has been helpful with nightmares, anxiety in the transition to high school, and interaction in general.

Throughout the process, Service Dogs of Alabama responded to our concerns, provided training suggestions, conducted follow-up training, and is working to find a match for our son.

After a few years of searching, Service Dogs of Alabama was not only the best costing organization, but provided a well trained service dog, assistance when we had issues with public places that hassled us about the service dog being in the facilities.

I cannot thank Ashley and Francis enough for what they have done for our family!

Sincerely,

David B.

name: CHEYANNA DENNIS
text: Hi guys I don't know you so I wanted to tell you people that I am In Missippi and I am missing a shih-tzu In Alabama and the color of him is Blond and A little Brown and he does not have a color and the very last thing is his name is Olaf If you find him come down to me on county road Thank You.

name: Arthur Stanton
text: Absolutely wonderful,wish I could work there.The staff is the best I have seen anywhere.

name: Chuck Fusina
text: Ashley and Francis are true professionals that dramatically changed the quality of life for my son, they will do everything they can to help you. We thought we would never be able to raise the money, but with some effort, and prayers we made it happen! The service dog has been a true blessing, and he is so well trained that all we receive is compliments when the dog is out in public. I would HIGHLY recommend Service Dogs Alabama to everyone! They are doing such amazing work and are two of the nicest, most dedicated people you will ever meet!

name: Kelly Henson
text:
My son has type 1 diabetes. He was diagnosed 6 years ago. A true blessing came to us a little over a year ago. That was Service Dogs of Alabama. The entire process has been and remains to be amazing. This organization changes lives. They start with an amazing and very thorough training process and continue with placement of these services dogs in their forever homes. They continue the relationship with the families after the placement is made. They are always available to answer any questions and continue helping in any way they can.

My son's dog, Pierce, has brought a peace of mind to our family that we never thought we would have again.

Pierce means everything to us. He is my son's life line. He alerts when his blood sugars are out of range so that he can correct the issue and avoid potential problems.
The founders, Frances and Ashley, are completely committed to helping people find have a better quality of life when life has dealt them struggles.
Pierce is our family. Service Dogs of Alabama became our family too!!!

name: K Morgan
text: My daughter has had her service dog for almost a year now. We cannot imagine our lives without her in it! She is the most intelligent, well trained dog. This is an amazing group of people who truly have a passion for what they do. Still to this day, if I have a question the response is always fast. Ashley made sure my daughter was comfortable and confident in working with her dog. You will not be disappointed with SDA! They have been a blessing to my family!!

name: Tank Holland
text: website was easy to navigate look like good training going on there but everytime I hit service dog training it said that the training was not available I gave it to stars for the website and we'll keep checking back to find out when they have service dog training going on

name: Bill Watters
text: I can attest Service Dogs of Alabama has changed the lives of many for the better. My son Matt was diagnosed with Type 1 Diabetes at age 4. After reading an internet article on Diabetic Alert Dogs (DAD’s) my wife and I was motivated to find more about how a DAD could improve the quality of life for Matt and our family. We found many stories of success and quite a few horror stories as well. In our search, we ran across the name of a dog trainer in our area, Frances. I called Frances and told her our story. I told her of our fear of Matt going to sleep and not recognizing a low then going into a seizure. I told her of how we feared Matt coming up on driving age and getting in the car after practicing sports and not realizing a low blood sugar and having a seizure while driving. We had these fears because Matt had seizures due to failure to recognize the signs and symptoms of low blood sugars. I was hoping Frances could point me in some direction but she did much more than that. After hearing our story, she told me she worked with a service dog organization but their organization had never trained a DAD but if we were willing to work with her she would do her best to help. We did and so did she. Frances and Ashley worked to develop was has become a very successful Diabetic Alert Dog Training program at Service Dogs of Alabama. We are very thankful for all this organization has done for all they work with.

name: Erica Lewis
text: We found this organization because my sister needed a seizure alert dog. Service Dogs of Alabama not only works with volunteers to lower the cost of a service dog, but it also works with the individual families and recipients to help them understand how their life will change with a service animal. Speaking about service dogs alone, I am so grateful that my sister has the autonomy, confidence, and overall sense of safety that comes along with her dog. Beyond that, the organization itself is truly a gift to all who come into contact with it. For my sister, the trainers have been nothing but supportive and only a call or text away when she has a question or concern. For myself, I am currently socializing a service dog as a volunteer, and it has helped me to understand what it is like to have a service dog in addition to giving me the opportunity to help educate others about them. I would suggest volunteering here to anyone looking for a place to donate time or resources, because it is such a great cause. Service animals save lives every day, and Service Dog of Alabama makes this a possibility for families and individuals who would not usually be able to afford it.

name: Daniela Gaskie
text:
Ashley will find whatever reason to take the service dog back so she can resell it!!
They will take your money and then take back the service dog that is undertrained!
My seggestion, go to a different company.

name: Rebecca Knight
text: A great organization

name: Robert Brown
text: I had a sudden schedule conflict come up with a group training I'm registered before. I've emailed, texted and called, and I can't get a response from anyone. It's extremely frustrating.

resp.text: Hi Robert - I just saw your message and responded. I will personally investigate this situation and we will do whatever we can to remedy it. Thank you for the feedback, and I apologize. Normally our students receive prompt responses from us, so I am not sure what happened.

name: Melissa Overhuel
text:
I first met Rebecca while looking for help with my puppy, Jango, who became leash reactive around 5 months old.  She is one of the most caring individuals I have ever met and very clearly cares about her students and their humans.  After working on my dog's reactivity we were able to go on and complete her entire training course offerings and she was very accommodating to my dogs special needs in regards to his reactivity.  I later adopted a deaf and neurogically impaired dog and she showed me the same level of accommodation to ensure that we could be as successful as possible.  I am a nurse and often had scheduling conflicts in order to complete our group lessons and Rebecca would often find a space in another group for us to make up our class or schedule a private lesson in order to ensure we recieved all of the instruction and skills we needed.
Rebecca and her team are all wonderful dog folks and the best in Birmingham as far as I am concerned.  I have said before and will always say that taking classes with LTTT was the best investment I could have ever made in my dogs.

resp.text: We all LOVE you, Jango, and Aayla!! I'm so glad that the training has benefited all of you. We miss you!

name: Cat Waselkov
text: We did several classes with both of our dogs and highly recommend LTTT. The puppy class was perfect for socializing and helping our puppy become more confident in navigating the world. The obedience and impulse control classes taught us so much about positive reinforcement-based training, and our relationship with our dogs benefitted immensely. Rebecca was also able to give us online private lessons to work on some additional tricks, allowing our younger dog to earn an AKC trick title. Rebecca really cares about each and every dog in the class, and we are so grateful that we found her. Rebecca was incredibly flexible about scheduling. We were able to do several classes despite me working full time and being in grad school.

resp.text: Thank you so much, I'm so so glad that you enjoyed your lessons as much as I enjoyed them with you guys! And I'm especially glad that we continued to be able to work together through the magic of the internet haha! Keep in touch!

name: Leslie Cak
text: I highly recommend the classes and trainers at Love Them, Train Them, LLC!! If you have an anxious puppy like I do, please take them to their Yappy Hour (a puppy socialization class) and Nervous Nellie (a confidence boosting class) classes and then keep signing up for classes and/or private training sessions because it is SO MUCH FUN to learn with your dog using positive reinforcement! Yuki (my almost year old Great Pyrenees) and I have had a blast with the awesome trainers at LTTT and I know you and your furbaby will too!

resp.text: Thank you so much Leslie! We have all enjoyed getting to work with you and Yuki and watching her grow up! Thank you for putting your trust in us all!

name: Peter Waselkov
text:
10/10 My dogs loved it and Rebecca is the best!

My dogs attended the first and second level basic training classes and had the best time. These are dogs that usually don’t listen to a word I say, yet still remember and follow the commands they learned in those classes.

One thing I really liked about Rebecca’s approach is that each week isn’t something totally new— it builds on the previous week’s progress. By the end, it seems like a massive behavioral improvement because of the gradual shaping of behavior over the course.

My spouse and I frequently had to trade off on who would take the dog to that week’s session, but Rebecca and her team were diligent with making sure we were using the proper commands learned on earlier weeks before progressing.

You’re not going to find a more caring and attentive group of people, and certainly not for such reasonable rates.

resp.text: Thank you so much Peter! I love those babies so much and wish that you guys still live here in town so we can continue our adventures further!

name: Aditi
text: While Rebecca is a fantastic trainer, a 6 week basic obedience class took 9 weeks to finish because of last minute cancellation/postponement notices from Rebecca. I would not go back as I fear my time will not be respected.

resp.text: I'm so sorry Aditi. As I discussed with you and your classmates, my father passed away during that time. I have never lost a parent so it was a very difficult time for me. I never miss a class unless it is due to something critical. Minnal did a wonderful job in beginner class, and I hope you will change your mind and return because I loved working with him and you guys. <3

name: Madison B
text: The best in Birmingham! I travel from 35 minutes out of town to bring my dogs to train with Rebecca! If you’re looking for a truly 100% positive reinforcement, fear-free and force-free trainer, this is it. My dog Gemma took the Impulse Control class and Rebecca was friendly, professional, knowledgeable, and kind. She is truly making a difference in improving dog-owner relationships and I’m so thankful to have found Love Them Train Them! My dog’s impulsive, hyper behavior has really improved with the training. They are also super responsive to emails and send training “homework” you can refer back to to keep practicing even after your classes end! I’ve already registered for the agility class with my other dog and can’t wait to start!

resp.text: Thank you so much Madison!! I ADORE Gemma and it has been so much fun getting to know you both! Keep up the good work and we'll see you soon!

name: Amber LeClaire
text: I've completed SEVERAL of Rebecca's training classes with my dogs. From puppy classes (great for socialization and bonding) to her more advanced classes (the most recent being for therapy work for my older dog who successfully completed his therapy dog certification, thanks to Rebecca's knowledge of the process and training involved). Rebecca really is a dog-whisperer. Not only is she great with your dog, she is great with YOU. My dogs are far quicker to catch on to commands than I am and Rebecca has infinite patience with me as she knows I sometimes get flustered when I feel I'm not doing something right. She is supportive and encouraging to both dog and handler. It is SO RARE to find that combination. Rebecca is a Birmingham treasure and her teaching methods are so wonderful and fun! I cannot recommend her and her Love Them, Train Them staff enough. ALL THE STARS!

resp.text: 💜 Wow, thank you Amber!! I am so very proud of you and your babies and all that you are accomplishing and will continue to accomplish!

name: Ivana Dill
text:
I can't say enough good things about Love Them Train Them LLC.  This review will be long but also describe my experiences so that people can get a good idea of the company. The first course I took with them was Impulse Control with my dog Arnold. He and I had completed beginner and intermediate obedience courses with another company.

We just happened to go to Love Them Train Them for Impulse Control because their schedule better matched ours at the time. Meredith Dempsey, is a great teacher to human and pup students.

We learned so much-got much more out of it than I ever dreamed. I decided to take Arnold to their tricks training course. They were very transparent that while they teach the how, not all dogs may be able or may want to do all of the tricks. The company emphasizes force free training and they follow through with this. HOWEVER,  the trainers, Rebecca (owner and trainer) and (Ally-trainer) made it so much fun that Arnold would come home and just offering to do tricks.

While we were taking the tricks training course, we ended up adopting a dog (Ginger) from a shelter. The trainers at this company had all worked with her at the shelter (she was being considered to become a fire dog at one point) and know of her excitability and energy levels. I mention that to mention that I chose to enroll her in beginner obedience.

Another company had evaluated her temperament for daycare purposes and considered Ginger reactive and unable to do daycare or interact with other dogs safely at the time. They suggested reactive dog training courses. Now, we already had Arnold. Arnold is pretty chill so I figured they would get along. For me, it was rough at the beginning because it was an adjustment for all of us and a first in regards to having a multi dog household.  It wasn't love at first sight but Ginger was not reactive towards Arnold.

I brought up my concerns with Love Them Train Them. Meredith suggested I get a second opinion regarding daycare and suggested a specific daycare. Ginger did very well and the staff at that daycare were quite surprised that I had been told Ginger needed reactive dog training before going to daycare.  Rebecca and Ally reassured me that Ginger has great learning abilities and that Anthony (the one currently teaching the beginner obedience course we are taking) would be excited to have us.

I reached out to Anthony before the course regarding the other company's thoughts as to Ginger being unable to take a beginner obedience course until a reactive course was taken. Anthony (who had worked with Ginger a good bit at the shelter-so I am sure that helped) told me he would make it work. And he has. The improvement in the past month has been incredible. Ginger does need a little more classroom modification that the other dogs but bit by bit, the modification is becoming less and Ginger is continuously improving. Even though Ginger already knew Anthony, watching him work with the other dogs has me fully convinced that even she hadn't know him, she would still do well.

During all of this, Ginger and Arnold had been getting used to each other. And me, used to having two dogs. Some things came up that caused me to question Arnold's and Ginger's capability of safely living together. But, when I reached out to Meredith (who knew and had worked with both dogs) she told me that both Arnold and Ginger are great communicators and to trust in my dogs' ability to communicate. This helped me to relax during their interactions (they love to play rough) which in turn helped them better enjoy others' company.

I could add so much more but in a nutshell: Love Them Train Them only uses force free methods, packs in a lot into one class, are willing and capable to work with what others may see as problematic, and their classes are fun!

resp.text: Wow! Thank you SO much for this great feedback, Ivana!! As you know, our entire team adores Arnold and Ginger! It is an honor to have you in class!! ❤ Thank you for entrusting us with their education!

name: Jeannie Bailey
text: Love the positive method of training and watching my dog learn and begin to know what I wanted without demands. No one wants them to lose their personality, just channel their energy into a positive direction. A great way to form a super bond with your dog!

resp.text: Aw, thank you Jeannie! We love having you and C man in class!

name: Tara Bugg
text: We took our 10 month old pit mix in for training. Mainly because she was regularly swallowing socks and nothing we tried worked to get her to drop them not swallow them. I had little faith this would make an impact. After the first class when we started with such simple basics I still didn't have faith. After the six weeks I will say I was so wrong. Everything our trainer taught us was great. In complete honesty we also didn't so our homework as diligently as we should have. The dog now readily knows stay, sit, touch, drop it, leave it, and come. She didn't do great on the tricks, but I wasn't worried about that and again we didn't work with her on those as much. She has gotten socks among other things and she now drops them or leaves them. I'm so thankful we did the class, I only wish we would've done it earlier. I would definitely recommend it!? Even our six year old dog started picking up on some of the good behaviors just from watching us work with her sister. Five stars!!

resp.text: Thank you for the feedback, Tara! I am so glad things are going well for you guys at home! It makes me so happy to know that what you learned in class was helpful. ❤

name: Liz C.
text: These trainers have been such an amazing resource and support system for me and my dog! I'm really happy to continue training with them as he grows and I recommend them highly!! Give them a try and you'll see why their approach is top notch!

resp.text: Thank you Liz!! We are so happy to have you guys in classes with us.

name: Beth M
text: I enrolled my mixed lab at 8 weeks old, one day after I picked him up from Two by Two Rescue.  The class was for Basic Obedience Training.  Believe me, training starts at day 1.  You will be glad you did.  Meredith D. Is the best!

resp.text: She is SO the best! So glad you are enjoying class!!

name: David Marvin
text:
I have a very, very active 17 month old Lab who has been hard to control and loves to escape into the front yard to chase the neighbor's cats.  I normally have to get into my car and try to drive around and lure her in, hoping she does not get hit by a car.  This past Monday we finished a 6 week beginner obedience class with Meredith.

I was taking the trash out last night and went out the basement door next to where the cats hang out.  The trash bag hit the door and opened up and Willow ran out after the cats.  We have a very busy road and it is not a place for dogs to run around off the leash.  It is bad.

Instead of chasing her, I grabbed some bags and rattled them and started using high pitch come and touch commands that we learned in the class.  She came sprinting back and I went to grab her by the collar and it slid off!  She ran off to the other house up the street.  I was scared to death.  I remembered our training and was able to keep calm.  I went into the basement and grabbed her bag of dog food, rattled it, and gave the touch and come commands again in a high pitch, excited voice.  She sprinted back into the garage!! I closed the door and gave her a treat and praised her.

Thank you for making this possible!

resp.text: David, this makes my day!! Thank you so much for sharing!

name: Jessica Morris
text: Rebecca is the absolute BEST! I can’t say enough about her talent as a trainer, but also as a professional. I have taken her Tricks Class and have also had her to my house for personal training. She is kind and patient, and has the heart and passion, that sets her above the rest! I recommend her to anyone and everyone.

resp.text: Thank you so much Jessica!! It is my passion. Loved having you and Byrd in class!

name: Alison Johnston
text: We have worked with Rebecca  to complete Advanced Dog Training class and a Tricks Class.  She is a great teacher. She teaches you to teach and train  your pet.  She also is great about helping you understand your pet's reactions so that you can be the most effective trainer with your animal.  I highly recommend signing up for any and all of her classes.

resp.text: Thank you so much! I am so glad that you enjoyed the classes and that we have gotten to spend lots of time together in class over the years!

name: Casey Schaffer
text: AMAZING trainer! My Mulligan went through her advanced training with the goal of hopefully being able to pass the REALLY hard Hand in Paw therapy dog test. Thanks to all of her hard work he passed with flying colors! text: Started taking our 18 month old GSD here a few weeks ago. He is very high strung and suffers from anxiety which leads to nuisance barking. The owners at Infinity listened to what we had to say (the place near home said he was an aggressive dog) and wanted to charge accordingly. Infinity had us being Bailey in FIRST to gauge how he acts. He knew it was a mix of anxiety and impulse control. Having trained dogs for years, LaDale knew we needed to work on those two areas. In 4 sessions we already see an improvement. He is more relaxed around strangers and doesnt jump straight to 10. Today was the 1st time we introduced another dog and he was anxious but did better than expected. We are glad we found them. The prices are very reasonable and they will work with you. Love these guys! We are getting a dog we can enjoy all the time.

text:

name: Lori Goldberg
text:
Do NOT take your dogs here!
This place is not sanitary. The workers leave dogs in pee and poop filled kennels for hours before they are cleaned.
The dogs don't go outside from 4pm to 7am the next day.
They have had 2 cases of kennel cough since spring break, and have still been using the same sponge to clean all of the dog bowls.
If your dog is having a health issue while boarding, the workers will not tell you about it if they don't think it's serious. There are dogs who get incredibly sick either from stress or other health problems that result in blood in the vomit and/or stool. The only thing they do is take the dogs food and water away and don't let them outside.
The dogs water bowls are only checked at 7am and then again at 4pm. So your dog may be going without water for any number of hours between those times and the workers will ignore it. The bowls are only cleaned once per day, so if your dog is boarding for several days, there's a very good chance that they'll have the same bowl of water over the course of their stay. They have a major rat problem there, so often times there is rat feces in the water bowls.
The dogs are left alone all night with the rats, which your dogs could be eating over night, making them very sick and possibly catching diseases.
The workers do not have first aid training, so if your dog chokes on the mulch that is outside in the play area, then they are told to "look up an instructional video" to help the choking dog.
They don't pay attention to what the dogs are doing because they're too busy on their phones to care. So if your dog poops mulch (very bad for his digestive system) then it's because they were eating it from the play area. There are also several dogs who eat poop, so if your dog has that habit, it's probably only getting worse because they think they're allowed to do it while staying there.
When the dogs are playing outside, they are sometimes not given water for several hours due to certain dogs not liking the water hose.
I have witnessed a coworker giving the wrong dog her medicine. Once that realization was made, still nothing was done about it.
If your dog is not good with other dogs, they are set as "individuals" where they play by themselves. These dogs are only getting 10 minutes outside to play, and then they get 10 minutes inside to play. They are supposed to have another 10 minutes to play but are usually skipped because the workers want to go home early. So if your dog is boarding over the weekend and they're not good with other dogs, then they're only getting about 20 minutes of outside time every day while the other dogs get over 2 hours.
The weekend hours are different, so all of the play groups are shortened and the dogs are left alone for a lot longer than they normally would be.
Their medicine is put in pill pockets in their food. If the dog doesn't voluntarily eat the pill pockets, then that dog will not be getting their medicine that day.
The dogs only have access to their food for a couple hours a day. So if your dog is a grazer and doesn't eat all of their food at once then they will be eating very little over the course of their stay.
The kennels are painted very poorly, paint is always chipping off the walls, usually because dogs are chewing it off.
Workers regularly spray dogs in the face with Bitter Apple spray. This spray is supposed to be used for dogs that have problems chewing their fur, and is not meant to be sprayed in the eyes or nose of the dogs, but they are regularly sprayed in the face if they are barking in their kennels.
If you request for your dog to be given a bath, they will usually bathe the dogs very early in the day to get it out of the way. Once they're bathed, they are not allowed back outside and their food and water bowls are taken away. So if you dropped your dog off at 8am to be picked up around 5pm, there's a good chance that your dog hasn't been outside or had food or water since about 10am.

resp.text:
Hi Lori, I wanted to reply here as well since I did not hear back from you regarding this same review you left on Facebook.
I'm truly sorry this is how you felt about working at CDT.

As one of the owners, and the person responsible for systems management in the locations I am very upset to hear these things. I'm also very concerned that not once had myself or any of the owners been contacted or told any of these things throughout the course of your employment there.

Because I can assure you, that not one thing you have said is company policy or are reflective of our systems we've built over 40 years.

There's nothing I can say to refute your claims because you cannot prove a negative, all I can say is that if you truly felt this way you should have come directly to myself, Margaret or Damian the multiple times we are all there per day whether helping out, working on things or just leaving our own dogs there for boarding or daycare.

At the end of the day, I'm sorry you feel this way about CDT. We have been doing this for over 40 years at this point, and have thousands of satisfied clients and dogs that I would hope reflect otherwise. If you would like to talk further or share specifics please send me a message because I would like to know details so I can address anything possible.

name: Michelle Curtis
text:
If you’re in the Fort Rucker area your search for a dog trainer can end with Heart of Dixie. If you want to own a large breed and/or highly intelligent dog, you need a trainer to show you the proper way to gain trust, confidence, and mutual respect. I have worked with a lot of different trainers in states where we have been stationed and hands down Ken (owner of Heart of Dixie) is phenomenal. As a novice dog owner or new to training, you always want to interview trainers and see what they do with their own dogs. It speaks volumes!

Many trainers will work “miracles” with the aid of an e-collar and your dog is ready to go in 3 weeks or so. How many of those trainers have e-collars on their own dogs for every day life? What are you going to do if the batteries aren’t charged or the collar misfires? A dog needs a foundation, confidence, and be able to think on their own for dependability. An owner needs to put in the work and follow through with the training plan to hold up that foundation. Then one may want to add an e-collar for off leash reliability on hikes or very rare circumstances.

If you want a trained dog that will listen to you, go with Ken. Ken is beyond educated in his field and most importantly can read you and your dog quicker than you can say hello. I had spent 2 years doing private classes with other trainers so I’m a little more particular and experienced than most, but by no means am I professional trainer. I reached out to Ken on a Friday and the following week he was at my house doing a 3 hour consult! He gave me a few new tools I needed for my rescue German Shepherd Puppy that I did not use for my prior GSD. He boosted my confidence in my prior training and gave me homework with resources to back it up.

My husband, with no formal training experience beyond a big box puppy class 5 years ago, was able to ask endless questions to curb his frustrations. Within 6 hours of Ken leaving our house, my husband commented that our 6 months old shepherd was already walking A+ for him (compared to the average C walk they were getting). This is all with a regular collar and leash... you read that correctly... walking a rescue that we have had for 6-7 weeks with no prong, no slip, nor e-collar. They were finally on the same page together and ready to go. They still have bonding to do, but the tone has been set.

We will be utilizing Ken in the near future for check-ins (fine tuning), training with another dog present, and more advanced public settings. Please note all of this will be done while I’m approaching my third trimester of pregnancy and after with a newborn plus our other young children. Our goal is a dog that is so well behaved he can go anywhere, and in return we are committed to putting the time in. There are no excuses when it comes to training. You only need 10-15 minutes sessions with your dog a few times a day to keep you both on the same page.

resp.text: Thank you Michelle for this very thorough and honest review about us here at Heart Of Dixie Dog Training LLC. I'm happy that I was able to help you and your family. I look forward to us working together in the future.

text: I had the pleasure of serving with Ken, so when I was looking for someone to train my male German Shepherd and female shepherd mix, the decision to drive from Tennessee to Alabama was an easy one. name: Savannah Szabo
text: Dog ownership is such a rewarding, exciting, and special experience ... but without the proper training and time, it can also be very stressful and overwhelming. This is where Ken shines; with his expert advice and intervention, his business Heart of Dixie Dog Training can help you improve and nurture that special bond you have with your dog/dogs. I have a 3 year old black German Shepherd named Nova. She is my pride and joy! But a couple years ago, I was feeling so helpless - like I was failing her. She was hyper; she was wayyyy too smart for her own britches; she was out of control. I wanted to work on basic commands and training, but I had young children to take care of as well, so that fell to the wayside. Luckily, I was referred to Ken and I enrolled in the group classes he taught in Enterprise at the time. Once a week, we would get together with our pups and put in the work. Ken taught me how to create that trusting connection with Nova, sensing her needs and behaviors, and vice versa. We quickly mastered “Place,” “Down,” “Stay,” “Come,” as well as no pulling on the leash and other helpful commands. With the help of HOD Dog Training, we built a great foundation from the ground up, using positive reinforcement and certain commands that would ensure I, the owner, was the leader and she was the follower. Now, I really feel like we have laid the groundwork and could accomplish anything. I plan to work with Ken and Heart of Dixie Dog Training in the near future to work on calling her back off-leash, “Leave it,” and other more advanced commands.

resp.text: Thanks Savannah for this positive review about your experience with Heart Of Dixie Dog Training LLC. It was a pleasure working with you and Nova during group class in Enterprise. Nova really shined in class and was a fast learner. Because you did a great job practicing with her in between classes. I look forward to working with you both in the future.

resp.text: Thank you Shelley for the review about your experience with Heart Of Dixie Dog Training LLC. I enjoyed working with both you and Trixie. She's a well trainable dog and did a great job with learning. If you ever need anything else please don't hesitate to ask.

After the second week I picked Piper up and we had a review of what all she has learned and he also worked with me on how to give the commands. I was and still am very satisfied with her training. I highly recommend Heart of Dixie Dog Training for anyone wanting their dog to have some training by an experienced and professional animal lover.

text: By far one of the worst vet experiences. When he did finally call back 3 days later (!!)  he treated me like I was being dramatic. However, because of his lack of care and negligence we ended up in the ER vet spending $1000 when it would have been a much cheaper fix in his office had he just taken the time to run the appropriate tests.  Even when I called to tell him about the ER visit he never called back, which again only shows how little he cares about the health of his patients. My cat was very sick and in pain the whole time he was ignoring us, and I would never suggest anyone bother with this clinic. Go somewhere that cares, like Rehm. You'll pay more but you'll get legitimate care and your pets will be much safer.
