name: Erin Calvert
text:
This local Dog establishment is violating multiple heath codes. The owner of this facility and the manager were told on multiple occasions by employees and were aware of the following: Fire extinguishers (they only have 2) being extremely out of date, last checked back in 2015— also no evacuation plan, or safety drills, air vent maintenance doesn’t take place— vents/filters not properly maintained can easily catch fire, this company works with LIVE animals, the safety of your dogs are not being considered as you can tell from the images.... everything is layered with years of dog dander and hair.
When the heater gets turned on the smell of burning hair lasts for days and the company uses wax melts up front to mask the smells. They also stuff the vents they don’t clean with smell good beads to mask the smell.
Even daycare dogs are kenneled. Employees hang around upfront until around 9 when they decide to start putting dogs in daycare—- this means if you’re paying for a full day or even a half day of doggie daycare starting in the morning your furbabies are missing out on 2+ hours of socialization. This facility doesn’t properly clean the daycare room. And weeks worth of hair is noticeable near the drains in the daycare play areas, this is extremely unsafe for your animals/the employees. The smell in this building that’s separate from the building your drop off your dog is horrific. Dogs are left unsupervised in daycare, and the daycare supervision in maintained outside of the daycare rooms- so instead of dogs getting that one-on-one attention they are only monitored when barking has increased. Because of that, rooms aren’t cleaned right away causing burns on paw pads from dogs playing around in urine. Most dogs have to be ran through Grooming to be spot cleaned before leaving. Bored dogs have started eating the walls of this establishment because of the lack of social interaction they receive. This facility illegally mentioned to employees that they can not pay overtime to them when they have worked 40+ hrs. Because of this, I believe the care of the animals that go there are being affected.
During the recent snow storm an employee managed to chase a already nervous dog around the front lobby of this establishment causing him to run out of the front door. This dog was missing for a week and found with his hip shattered, and he had ate an entire toe off of himself.. this establishment paid his vet bill which included the cost of utilization. Clearly the proper training of employees is not being conducted. This facility also does not clean kennels often and when they do they use a dirty mop to wipe out the kennels. This is probably a factor to the outbreak of kennel cough they are currently battling.
Many times employees just feed  dogs breakfast without even bothering to clean the kennel first or move the dog to a clean kennel.. that means that they were eating breakfast in their own filth and kenneled with it until daycare started up. In It’s hard enough trusting someone, let along finding out an establishment you’re paying LOTS of money to is neglecting your animal. This establishment recently caused the death of a small 4 lb dog, and they are trying to cover it up. By deleting comments and blocking any negativity they receive. I refuse to be silent. This facility is anything but transparent!!!

name: Shannon gilmore
text: I wouldn't take my two babies anywhere else!! They love everyone there! My oldest dog is nervous around strangers and he doesn't hesitate to run up to everyone there. The groomer is amazing and I have never been disappointed. I have a 6 year old male dorkie (dachshund/Yorkshire terrier) and a 1 year old female schnorkie (schnauzer/Yorkshire terrier), who are both rescues. I recommend pipers to everyone

name: Faith Wright
text: Great place for our fur babies! They pups love to play and the staff all take good care of pets.

name: Rebekah Shierling
text:
They kept my lab for a few days. She has never been boarded or been to doggie daycare. She came back to me just the way I dropped her off. They were very understanding as to her walking for 15 minutes. They posted pictures of her playing daily! They said she enjoyed herself and they loved her. I would bring her back because for the first time in 6 years I didn't worry about picking my dog up and them being under stress, no walked enough, kept in a crate all day, or not being checked on plenty.

Thanks to piper's dogowners can rest easy knowing their pups are being pampered to the fullest in a clean environment!

I even called and ask if my lab could stay one more day one the day I was supposed to pick her up from our trip and they were happy to let her stay in her room!

resp.text: Can't wait to see Mocha again!

name: wild rose
text: It is a daycare ONLY!!!! THEY NO LONGER ADOPT DOGS OUT!

resp.text: Piper's Playhouse is a boarding, daycare, training and retail facility, but you are correct about the rescue. We had to close the Piper's Rescue in 2018 due to the lack of income to keep it running. We do work with other local rescues in order to continue helping in the community as much as possible. Piper's also holds drives for the the local animal shelters at least once a year to help in that aspect. Piper's Rescue a

name: Rachel Bonnett
text: Wonderful with my Tod his hairstyle always looks amazing.

name: Marilyn Hart
text: Piper's Playhouse has been a lifesaver!!! We recently got a very sweet but very high energy rescue...Smokey:)  They were not scared off by his hyper-self and have been a wonderful help in helping me make his entrances and exits not so wild LOL;). I live and work in Gadsden so add 3 hrs and 140 miles to each work day for Smokey to go there...it's worth all that extra effort bc I know he is well taken care of(they welcome me calling to check on him), having fun, and will be toast when I pick him up, which makes nights much more manageable;). This place of business is clean, professional, helpful, loving, and a blessing for dogs and dog owners!!!

name: Kate Upchurch
text: Prior to this past visit I'd have written a great review but when I picked my little guy  ( a shih tzu )up on Christmas Eve I was horrified! Shaking, limping and handed dirty bedding with no explanation as to how he was injured, why we weren't informed  when it happened plus finding out he'd been very stressed by being kenneled every night in the large room with the large dogs with big dog barks! When I first boarded @ Piper's 2 years ago I requested that he be kenneled at night with only little dogs and was shown a room off the hall on the right where I was told the small dogs stayed. When I asked why he was put in the big room this time with the big dogs she said "well, you didn't request that he be separated". If my file had been consulted I'm sure it would reflect my wishes. There was no I'm sorry we didn't contact you about his injury, etc. He literally had to be carried that night and Christmas day every time to potty, to food bowl, etc. While I understand this may not be the norm @ Piper's, ( had never happened to me before) since it happened this time, I'll be making other arrangements next time. Beware. Things are not always as they seem. Ask to see where your dog will be put at night. I was told they  NEVER allow tours! That's shocking! I've ALWAYS toured where I board my dog. Ask what their policy is if your dog becomes injured or sick. I asked when the owner would be there as I wanted to speak in person with them and was told the owner was never at the Anniston location. Really? So, I've emailed the owner to express my concerns.

name: Wilson, Brandon David
text: To fire one on leave seem real... despicable. More care is given to pups than those mental. If you've paid the piper you know who I am. The management's a joke, but current employees are grand.

name: Leisa Cole
text: My dog loves this place! People working here are GREAT!

name: Alabama Zephyr
text: Wonderful staff and a wonderful doggie day care! Thank you!

name: Lawanna Wade
text: Thanks to Pipers Playhouse  for taking care ol Handsome  for the Wades !

name: Shawanda Edison
text: Prices aren't what they advertise. But it's a nice place to take your pet and know they are in good hands.

name: Micah Morgan
text:
Highly recommended! Never had a complaint! My babies have been groomed here, boarded here and had play dates in daycare! If they were misbehaved I would have them in the training classes as well. There prices are very affordale plus they have just lowered the prices! They always have some new homemade nutritional snack for sale on the counter and tons of things to buy for your fur baby. Ranginger from shampoos to clothes to toys to collars and leashes. You will not be disappointed. Thank you Pipers for making it easier for me to go on vacation without being weary of how my babies are. Yall are awesome!

Also I would like to add with being a former employee of Pipers Playhouse. Know that your baby is well watched and takenjoy care of. Blankets, kennels and play areas are washed daily with non harmful chemicals.  They have very interactive play during daycare, someone is always watching and spending time with your furbaby. Medicine is well charted and given correctly.  Staff does their very best at making your pets stay as easy and comfortable as possible. The owner is the most compassionate person I have met and treat every animal with respect and love. You must check out Pipers for yourself!

name: NameIs Private
text: Great people great service.  Thank you

name: Ms. D.
text: The front desk worker helped me a lot.

name: Cory Clifton
text: Great place for doggy day care

name: Toni Bell
text: My dog was boarded the weekend of July 4th. He was picked up today and reeked of urine as well as his bed that was sent. Highly disappointed and will not be using pipers playhouse again.

resp.text: I am very sorry you were disappointed with our services. Rudy (still being a puppy) did have accidents in his kennel at night. He also played VERY hard in doggie daycare each day. His bed and blankets were washed each day - but in the rush of dogs leaving today (July 5th) it was overlooked. I have addressed it with my Boarding Supervisor and it will not happen again! We would like to offer him a free full-service bath.

name: Maia Canning
text: The place smells strongly of urine.

name: Teresa Craven
text: The daycare is the best!!!!!!

name: Michelle Parker
text: Melissa and her awesome female team are truly superwomen. There’s a systematic approach to their training and they provide thorough training to families when their dog graduates. This is one of the first systems I’ve come across with training done with all the dogs together, which shows how effective the team is. Your dog trains under many distractions and real life situations so when your dog returns, they’ve been fully socialized, learn manners, and know their newly trained owner is going to follow through as instructed. Once your dog graduates training, Melissa’s door is open for dog boarding and doggy daycare.  I highly recommend taking advantage of this service, it allows your dog to remain socialized with other dogs and allows you to remain accountable at home. Should you have any fine tuning needed for your dog for a specific behavior or life circumstance, Melissa and team are right there for you. Literally without breaking a sweat or raising their voices, they give a dog a command and they listen which is quite jaw dropping to see in action. Our German Shepherd has gone from good dog with some leash and fence reactivity to an amazing dog. He’s still young and learning so we frequent Melissa’s weekly to keep him around all the other dogs of all sizes, genders, breeds, egos, etc.

name: Casey Faller
text: A+ training, if i could rate higher i would! Highly professional with update videos and pics throughout training and accommodating in the face of unforeseen circumstances. They took my German Shepherd puppy Aja for Puppy Boot Camp and the difference in focus and obedience is night and day. They gave me thorough instructions as well as videos specifically catered to Aja to follow through on to sustain good behaviors and the results speak for themselves. Couldn’t be happier with the results and would definitely recommend for anyone looking for a well trained dog. Im already looking forward to the advanced classes.

name: Kevin Belden
text: I don’t have enough good things to say about MHD!  Training is awesome, Facebook updates are awesome, boarding (if she trained them) is awesome...plus it’s like a training refresher course. Great place.

name: Josh Waldeck
text:
Melissa was the most valuable resource not only in training my dog, but in helping me understand how to raise a balanced and respectful dog with boundaries and manners.

My dog, Kara, went to Melissa’s training boot camp and learned how to behave in a pack, how to be respectful of other dogs’ boundaries, how to walk off leash with a training collar, and most importantly (for a German Shepherd) to be mellow and centered.

I can honestly say that Melissa and her training program defined my relationship with my dog, and prevented so many problems that I’m sure I would have had without her. Having tried training on my own, training with the PetSmart training program, and trying other local trainers, no other program came close to Melissa’s Happy Dogs. I can’t put a price on the services she offers. Highly recommended!

name: Irene Harris
text: Trained with an Alex Osborne, a very knowledgable and adaptive trainer. He adjusted to my level of training and genuinely valued my holistic state and well-being. While I was lifting, I really appreciated our talks on being natives of San Francisco and how staying fit physically and financially will definitely help in staying in San Francisco.

resp.text: Please delete this as this is not for my business.

name: CATHERINE BRYANT
text: Very helpful in making my dog off leash trained.

name: s w
text: Melissa was great with my 7 month goldendoodle, he came home a different guy, so obedient.

name: Katie Miller
text: My dog (Bernedoodle) went to Melissa’s puppy boot camp a rambunctious free spirited puppy that loved to jump on people, potty in the house and play bite with my children.  Within seven days of her camp - he came back still a fun loving puppy but WELL TRAINED. Melissa is AMAZING. I cannot believe the difference in my dog. He obeys his commands, walks/runs off leash, no longer jumps and no longer has accidents in the house! I cannot get over what she was able to do in a mere seven days. I would give her over five stars if possible. I highly recommend Melissa for dog training. Thank you Melissa for what you have done for Zig!

name: Ysaris Urbina Rojas
text: My dog loved it and I loved it even more! Will be back :)

name: Jean Smith
text: Great.  Can't say enough.  Saved our fur baby.

name: Mark Caldwell
text: Called twice never got a reply.

name: Chelsea Adams
text: We have a troublesome 3 year old husky who was just using the bathroom indoors and ruling the home. It been a few days since one of Melissa’s associates came to help us out and we’ve only had 1 accident since!!! She’s engaged our kiddos so they could help our girl practice and was super informative. We had used other trains and no luck, but Melissa and her crew are hands down my first recommendation for anyone!

name: Kyle Johnson
text: Completely fixed our dog!!

name: Kari Osborne
text:
My pup, Crockett, absolutely loves puppy preschool here!  We pull in the parking lot and he's already wagging his tail with excitement. He also happily walks back with associates every time.

While I love both the convenience to my home and the hours (6:30am-8pm 7 days a week), the best part is that he's completely worn out having had so much fun. 😉 Tired puppy snuggles are the best!

name: Kelsey Rollins
text: My dog got groomed here yesterday. I was very disappointed. He had a gauge taken out of his fur on his back all the way down to the skin, ears were so choppy and he was supposed to have a golden retriever cut and was shaved down. Poor baby looks terrible. I was really hopeful about this place but i was sadly mistaken. The manager I spoke with was super nice and refunded my money for the cut, I am glad they tried to make up for his cut.

resp.text: Kelsey, we greatly appreciate you taking the time to speak with us and for allowing us to address your concerns regarding your dog's grooming appointment. We understand your frustration and will use this feedback to work hard to improve the service we provide our clients and their pets.

name: Melissa Sentell
text: Our high energy puppy came home happy and tired after being boarded with the "all day play" option! All the staff was attentive and helpful. We definitely plan to bring him back on our next vacation!

name: Bert Davi
text: I was excited to see new location so close to my house. I have called 4 times to make a reservation and have never been able to speak to anyone. Maybe once or twice I can understand but seems like nobody can bother to answer a call.

name: A E
text:
I have taken my dog here a few times. Not only does my dog now have kennel cough, my dog has came home now with a nip to the ear, and had a wound on the butt area. None of this was there before I took my dog here. Staff is great and professional. More likely will not be taking my dog here again.

I just want to edit to add. He doesn’t have kennel cough. He’s actually a lot more sick. He’s running a fever between 103-105.3, lethargic, no appetite, and not drinking. We’ve been to the ER vet for the fever when it got to 105.3. He’s been to his normal vet and they have no idea what’s making him so sick. We’ve been given antibiotics and his fever still won’t go down. My dog became this sick after taking him here. I don’t know if another dog they let in had something that was given to mine or maybe the food and water bowls weren’t properly cleaned. Whatever it may be is slowly killing my dog and is becoming highly expensive in vet bills trying to find out what’s going on.

resp.text:
Thank you for providing your feedback and letting us know about this issue. We set a high standard for ourselves and are truly sorry to hear that we did not meet your expectations. Please call us at (205) 413-8164 and ask for the Resort Manager so that we can better assist you.

Thank you,

PetSuites Hoover

name: Jonathan Taylor
text:
This place is pretty annoying.  No one picks up the phone “taking care of dogs can’t answer”

Hire more people.  If you are going to act superior - be superior,  pay for a receptionist, and think about customer service

name: Erin Nelson
text: I was extremely nervous about boarding my sweet pup Lucy because the last time she was boarded she injured herself. The staff assured me that she would be well-cared for and that I would be notified of any issues and I received a tour before leaving her in their hands. She enjoyed her individual playtime and received lots of love during that time. Not only am I beyond pleased with the services provided, but I will ONLY be taking my girl to PetSuites of Hoover for future boarding needs.

name: Adrienne Samani
text:
Do not leave your dog here! I was at first very happy with pet suites and their services when they first opened. But they’ve grown so much too fast and without the proper staff to take care of your pet. They are too short staffed and are too overwhelmed, frustrated, and not communicating with one another well. I once left him for day care and asked if they could
feed my dog breakfast which they’re response was that it was a $29 fee. They didn’t feed him the entire day and would rather have him not eat for 8 hours over $29. Over the weekend that I boarded him they allowed me to pay the “gold package” when he was already approved for group play. They lied about sending photos as part of the package when I asked about it they said they had to “shift through the photos” before sending them but I never received them. When I went to go finally pick him up after receiving no word about him there was a woman in the group play area walking away from the dogs, shooing them, and yelling them to get away from her. It’s one woman and several dogs so I understand she’s overwhelmed but this is clearly a staffing issue. On a tour of the area before leaving my dog therein on the morning of our trip the cages had not been cleaned out and were dirty. I asked for a refund and they refunded me the price I paid for the gold package. I got my dog back tired and not happy. For the prices they are demanding this is the worst experience I’ve ever had at a dog boarding place. Please give time to this facility for them to find the proper amount of staff before leaving your dog here.

resp.text: Ms. Samani, thank you for taking the time to speak with me today.  I was so sorry to hear that Georgie’s experience did not live up to our usual standard of service.  We grow by hearing where our opportunities lie, and as discussed, your feedback will help us deliver the standard of care we guarantee.  I look forward to speaking with you soon to discuss the immediate improvements we’ve made to our services, and hope to see Georgie in the future.

name: Tiffany Williamson
text: The staff is awesome and the facility is great! I was having a flood emergency at my home. They took my dog in who has some anxiety and REALLY went the extra mile to make her comfortable and me as well. Very friendly and professional. I will definitely use them again and I strongly recommend them!!!!!! Ask for Carter he was awesome!!!!!

name: Donna Smith
text: I was very pleased with PetSuites Hoover grooming services.  I took my 15-year-old malti-poo to be groomed for the first time here. They took great care of my girl and she was there only 3 hours compared to an all day process.

name: Chibuike Ulasi
text: This place just opened. We toured the facility and it looks really beautiful. I believe the pets would have a great time here. We plan to send out dog in a few weeks.

name: Doretta Potts
text: I was very pleased with boarding my dog over the 4th of July.  They are very professional and nice to deal with.  I definitely would use them again.

name: Curry Bordelon
text: Friendly and helpful staff.  Clean facilities.  Our dog Ollie loves going.

name: Jim Schillinger
text: The staff here is amazing and facilities are new and clean! Our dogs love it!

name: Terry Reynolds Sr
text: Simply the best.

name: Cindy Palazzo
text: Bought our boy from them. He is very healthy and extremely smart. Totally recommend their pups!

name: Karis W
text: Lauren is awesome. She is incredible with dogs and very personable. We reached out to her because our dog had an overreacting issue and we were concerned with the safety of him being around our kid. Lauren took the time to teach us and spent as much time as we needed with us and our dog to get him back on track. He is now a happy and peaceful dog. He behaves better, obeys better, and loves our toddler to pieces. Lauren gave us our dog back and I will forever be grateful.

name: David Price
text: The best trainer I know of in Shelby County. Lauren trained my dog, Layla, several years ago and it was totally worth the money. Even though I keep one handy, I can go anywhere with Layla off leash and never worry about her running off or not listening to me.

name: Jennifer Templin
text: I am 100% satisfied with the outcome of Lauren and Hunter's training program. My dog is a completely different animal now. They stayed in constant communication with me while my dog was going through their training program, which made me feel at ease. They worked around my schedule to do our house calls after my dog finished their program, which was very convenient for me.

name: Amanda Frye
text: I contacted Lauren when I brought my Giant Schnauzer puppy home. I actually spoke with her prior to getting him. She even offered to go with me to pick him out. Anyway, she came to my house to meet me, my dog and explain her process. I immediately felt comfortable with her and her system. Through the obedience training I met Hunter, her husband and we (my dog & I) became part of their family. They are both easily accessible and accommodating. It has been life changing with my 50lb pup (expected to be 120lb). His and my quality of life is/will be most enjoyable due to Precision Canine's experience and knowledge. I am so thankful for them & highly recommend this company. my dog even boards with them. I would give them 20 stars

name: Chris Peters
text: Hunter and Lauren are true professionals  Hunter is even offering a home kennel design for my pup.  I feel like more than a customer of theirs.  Not only are they training my dog, but me to be a better pet owner.  I have already recommended them to a family member  and many others who ask why my big puppy is so well behaved.  Thank you for your patience and time Precision Canine

name: Josh Crane
text: Hunter & Lauren are amazing at what they do - not just training dogs, but more importantly, training humans. They have made our Dane an obedient giant, and made us much better dog owners in the process. The time, effort, and patience that they put into their work shows and is truly amazing. We would, and already have, recommend them to anyone interested in growing a better relationship with their dog. Definitely a great experience!

name: Suzie Newbill
text: I highly recommend Precision K9.  Their methods are worth the time and money. He is so happy to be pleasing us...and we are SO thankful for Lauren and Hunter. They are consistent and loving. You cannot go wrong here!

name: Daniel Benefield
text: We took our two dogs, a German Shorthair Pointer and a yellow Lab to Lauren and Hinter and we could not be happier with our choice. We have only had a few sessions and they are already showing such improvement! They have also trained us along the way which has made a huge difference. We also bought two collars from them and I wish I would have done so sooner, they are beautiful and durable. I can not say enough great things about precision canine, and we would recommend them to everyone!

name: Paul Odell
text: Good place to get Fido neet and clean

name: Vickie Stein
text: We have been through other professional training programs but Precision Canine is the best, hands on training we and our dogs received. Lauren & Hunter worked with us and our 2 dogs (German Shepherd, Rottweiler) at our home, their facility, parks, parking lots, etc.

name: Bonnie Barnett
text: We have three German Shepherd Dogs (GSD) and have contracted with Precision Canine, LLC to train two of them.  Lauren and Hunter work with our whole "pack".  The pack includes two human members, three dogs, and two cats.  Eleven year old GSD is our sweetest, no training at this point in her beautiful life.  We've had her since the age of 6 weeks.  Nearly nine year old GSD (had her since the fall) was a great challenge.  She has an incredibly strong prey drive.  Not good for the cats, nor the puppy.  At this point, she's our best behaved dog...purely because of the excellent intensive training and loving care she's received from Precision Canine, LLC.  She'll probably never give up on the cats, but she is a dog.  She spent weeks with Lauren and Hunter, assimilating to their pack.  They spent much time and effort and succeeded at teaching me how to interpret behaviors (and therefore, canine thoughts) and to handle a well trained dog.  I've been taught, also, to not apply my human emotions on my pets.  Five month old GSD (since the age of 12 weeks) is our cutest.  We've got a way to go with the youngest, but I'm so pleased to know that Lauren and Hunter will guide us every step of the way.  They took a situation which felt personally scary and unsafe to me and made me feel secure and confident.  That's a very good thing for the (sometimes) leader of the pack.

name: Brenda Harper
text: I just had my first training session with Hunter and my dog Mitzy.  I couldn't be more excited about the future. I adopted Mitzy from GBHS 4 months ago. She was a 3 mth old, 12 lb pit bull mix. Sweet and loving but biting at everything. Now she is 7 mths old, approx 45 lbs and pulling me all over the place. She is also very mouthy and wants to jump on everyone. I have grandkids in my home on a daily basis and they have never been able to play with her because of her bad habits. It didn't take long for me to realize she needed a different type of training other than what places like Pet Smart had to offer. I had gone so far as to sign her up for those classes when deep down I knew I couldn't control her from the parking lot to the store or around customers in the store.  I had to accept the fact that treats, diversion tactics and all my love was not going to work for Mitzy.  I had also taken her for evaluation and subsequently ruled out places I felt were too harsh (I'm a bleeding heart). I know she is going to receive the best training, care and love anyone could ask for at Precision Canine and that I'm going to receive the training I need to handle her properly.   It did not bother me to leave her there like I thought it would. I can see that although she is receiving strict discipline she is also having fun and being loved. Sure, I miss her not being here with me right now but I know beyond a doubt Mitzy and I are going to have a great life together thanks to Hunter and Lauren.

name: Jayson Karch
text: Great staff.  Great facility.  Worth every penny to train my dog.  He went from the devils spawn to a gentleman in 4 weeks.  Thank you very much ladies.  My family and I appreciate your hard work.

name: Katrina Stoess
text: We’ve had two dogs trained here with Ms Pam and Ms Laura. They have loved our furry family members every time they’ve worked with them. We’ve boarded several furry family members here too. We keep coming back every time, the whole team takes great care of them.

name: Brent “B & b Brickrails” Smith
text: Great place. Nice people.  She was happy. 🐕

name: Justin Augustine
text:
We do not recommend boarding your dog at Harvard’s K9. Our dog was injured under their care and they held us the owners responsible for the accident.

Our 2 week boarding turned into a $750 bill. There are plenty of boarders that can ensure safety more than this boarding facility.

name: Bobbie Getz
text: Our puppy was out of control until we took her for training  at Harvard's K9 Center, Inc.  We were amazed at how quickly and effectively her behavior improved with their guidance and help.  We are forever grateful and our dog is such a joy to us!

name: Whitney Boutwell
text: Very nice dock for the swimmers and agility course. Big open fields that are so beautiful to look at. Sign kinda hidden if coming from the left, very nice staff.

name: Shawn Mewhorter
text: I love this kennel/dog training facility. The trainers are excellent and kind and patient with both dogs and owners. The kennel is also great!  My dog loves to go there!  He is always excited to see them.  He's always happy to come home. . . I think! Lol

name: M Stevens
text:
Professional trainers & boarders.
Have boarded here of and on over the years with our dogs. Staff is friendly, facility is clean and well managed. Their dog runs are really nice whether inside or out or both. Much better than boarding at a vet in a cage. Secluded country setting.

name: Tanya Fleming
text: We love Harvard! Staff are friendly and professional and the grounds are very clean ! We are doing dock diving classes now and looking into training also !

name: Pam Jaindl
text: Best boarding care!!

name: Brenda Burdick
text: Laura is a GREAT dog trainer! We adopted a dog 2 mths. Ago and she's been a tremendous help!👍

name: Kaye Stevenson
text: Dock diving at it's best

name: Jasmine Adams
text: Good place to take your dogs

name: Julie Norden
text: Professional, yet comfortable. Knowledgable staff. Plenty of large  training areas. Kind, positive approach to dog training.

name: S. K. Cannady
text: Harvard is so special.  The facilities are the best.  The folks that take care of the pups absolutely love their guests.  They are extremely knowledgeable about dogs, training, care.  My entire family takes their dogs there.  Me and my beagles LOVE Harvard K-9.

name: LeejaClane
text: The staff were very clear about what to expect, and we're great about getting back to me when I checked on Izzy while she was there. The transformation when we picked her up was amazing! I love that once you've done in kennel training with them, you can bring your dog back for as many group classes as you want for the life of the animal.

name: Vanessa Oxford
text:
My dogs love Harvard's K-9 center.

Safety is my number one concern when deciding where to board my dogs. I am certain that they are safe when boarded at Harvard's. I made a pre-board visit to their facility before I made my first reservation. I was impressed by their setup and the way that they explained to me exactly how my dogs would be accommodated. There is no question that the staff at Harvard's is professional and puts the safety of each dog first.

During a cross country move my dogs boarded at Harvard's for over a month to ensure that they would be safe during the transition. It was the right thing to do, but let's be honest, no one wants to board their dogs for that period of time. Miraculously, even after having boarded for so long, my dogs still jump in circles when I ask them if they want to go to Harvard's. Unbelievable. If they had not been treated well they would fight me tooth and nail before placing one whisker back in the facility. Knowing, without a doubt, that my dogs are going to be happy and enjoy themselves when they are boarded makes me feel comfortable making plans to travel in the future.

Because of our positive experience boarding my dogs have become more involved by attending the dock diving classes offered by the center.  Lori, the instructor, is exceptionally patient with them. The attention and training that she gives my dogs has benefited them tremendously. One of my dogs has mobility challenges due to having bad knees. Getting in the water with Lori every week has changed his life. It is a joy to see him run around with abandon after his swim lessons. I will admit that I have shed a tear over seeing him come so far in his recovery. He would not be at his current activity level without attending Harvard's dock diving classes. I am extremely grateful that Harvard's and Lori provide a much needed outlet for my dog and others with similar needs.

On a human note, I also enjoy the class time spent outside with good people and enthusiastic canine company. Harvard's is located on a lovely piece of land and there is a lot to enjoy about their meticulously dog friendly setup. Attending a dock diving class is a wonderful way to spend an afternoon and I encourage you to try it! See you at the dock!

name: Saul Slowik
text:
I was truly impressed with the staff and the training offered here, especially given the low-cost.

The only reason I'm giving it 4 stars is that the facility is a little bit run-down. Otherwise, it is a wonderful space for pets to be boarded. They keep the animals separate when they are being played with, which is another plus.

name: Debi Miller
text:
The best place to leave my fur babies when we have to go out
of town. Lots of play time and not crated.

name: Stephanie Dunigan
text: Well at Harvard's group class. Mrs. Laura taught me the correct way to teach my Rock the basic commands he needs to follow. If in the future  I need a refresher I will be going back to Harvard's. I recommend Harvard's to anyone that is looking for not just training but training with love and care for your dog.

name: Mark Woodhams
text: We did the basic obedience course and were pleased with the instructors.

name: Famous Nate
text: A awesome place to bring your dogs!!! Very friendly and helpful

name: Barbara Carlson
text:
I have trained and boarded my dogs with Laura ever since she took over the K-9 Center from Stewart Harvard (20 yrs?) I raise service dog puppies now and although I can teach them basic obedience myself the group classes are excellent for exposure to other dogs of all kinds, plus the country distractions. The boarding facility is much better than the cages at the vet or the "boutique" facilities around town. Your dogs have expert care and outdoor places to exercise/play/+training. Laura and staff also do specialized one-on-one training for problems. Harvard is way out in the country (to me) off of Rt. 80 just past downtown Crawford AL. Use your GPS or call for directions.
Harvard's K-9 is the Ivy League of training/boarding. I give it 4 Paws, 5 stars

name: Julianna Pierce
text: I am sure they know what they're doing, but they were rude to me and my partner about our 4 month old puppy. Making accusations that we were poor owners and that we didn't socialize our dogs nor use treats, which is quite the contrary. My dog is smart. She knows when she's getting treats to do something she doesn't want to do and knows when she's getting treats because she performed well. Instead of getting to know my dog upon meeting her, the trainer threw a leash on her and immediately started dragging her through the water, causing her distress. My dog is a strong swimmer and loves the water. My dog immediately improved and was herself fetching the ball in the pool as soon as the trainer unleashed her and removed herself from the situation. The trainer needed to adjust her approach and be more compassionate (just as you would with humans because dogs are not all the same), but instead she was rude and accused us of being poor owners.

name: Charlie Baker
text: Great obedience dog training with my Border Collie Shep.  Enjoyed the experience and my dog is now well behaved.

name: Shannon Murphy
text: Very friendly and professional staff, they treat all the dogs like they are their own.

name: Vickie Rounsaville
text:
When we drive over the bridge going into Phenix City both Sugar and Ella know where they are going. They just love Harvards. I can not say enough nice things about them. I have had them train three of my dogs and we use them to board. When we have to go out of town, we have no guilt because we know that our fur people are being taking care of. When you drive up and your dogs get excited you know they are being treated well. I recommend them to all of my clients.

Vickie Rounsaville

name: Dee Nichols
text: Fun things to do with your dogs

name: David Edwards
text: My 2 dogs love this place.

name: Mandi Cooper
text: Great information

name: Don Hitchcock
text: Not easy to find.  Remote location.

name: Andrew Bowers
text: Great with animals

name: Rashell Hill
text: Trainers are very good

name: Crisa Slusher
text: Always superb

name: M Smith
text: My dog seemed to have a great time at doggy day care. He was happy and tired when I picked him up. The staff is incredibly knowledgeable and kind. The facility appears clean.

name: Matthew Mayo
text: We take our dog rascal here for grooming and daycare regularly. He’s always so happy and excited to go, and comes home tired out at the end of the day, which is quite a feat for a jack russell. The groomer always does a great job with him, and he looks (and more importantly smells) like a million bucks after. I’ve recommended JHH to all of my friends.

name: Wendy Montealegre
text:
I LOVE Just Happy Hounds.  First, the facilty is spotless.  And their stellar staff truly love these animals.  It's genuine.
I do quite a bit a rescue, and sweet Sarah Mills, Katelyn and the rest of this amazing staff have boarded several rescues. Teaching these dogs basic manners training and socialization.  This work helps ensure they will have a successful adoption later!
Just Happy Hounds not only provides excellent care for your personal dog, they do extensive community outreach, and have saved countless dogs.  I can't say enough good about them!!!

name: james meredith
text: Very nice people. Stayed late to meet me so I could drop my dog off on a sunday!!!

name: Brittany Stephens
text:
My dog began daycare at JHH at approximately 6 months old and attended at least 2-3 times per week. I always thought she enjoyed it as she seemed excited to pull up and be dropped off. At around a year old, I started noticing a lot of staff turnover at the facility. Although I should have taken heed, I did not and my dog continued to attend day care regularly. I began noticing that my dog was very timid of the staff. In particular, she was called by one of the managers/trainers and immediately backed up, tail between her legs, and laid down in a submissive position behind me. This time I took note and my dog never returned to the facility. I still have pre-paid day care days that will go unused. When I inquired about my dog’s reaction, it was explained to me by staff that my dog was regularly kept separate in a kennel in the back during the day. AND, that her “training” involved being taken into the yard, on a leash, while other dogs were allowed to approach her and she was given commands to obey. THIS RUINED MY DOG. She has dog aggression issues to this day, largely due to her extreme anxiety which I believe was engrained into her at a developmental stage while at JHH. Please do not take your dog to this facility for daycare.

Also, please note that most of the favorable reviews were posted at least a year ago. While the more recent reviews question the dogs well-being at the facility.

name: Emma Tolbert
text: Terrible! I paid $74 per night for my 2 senior-age shelties to be boarded in the “Beach House” suite while I was out of town. When they were picked up they were soaking wet and filthy, as if they had been left outside in the rain. They were also hungry, and an excess of their food was left that should not have been if instructions were followed. Definitely would not recommend if you are looking for your pets to be well taken care of!

name: Christina Fortugno
text: Just Happy Hounds needs to be your first and last look at daycare for your best friend. I moved to Birmingham a few months ago and did not know a soul. I came for graduate school with my best friend (Oliver) and the center of my world. I shopped around for daycares like my peers do for their human children. I chose Just Happy Hounds because the staff was friendly and I loved how my dog was always playing. He does not spend hours alone in a kennel like he would at home. They have far exceeded my expectation for customer service and outright exceptional care for my puppy. Oliver had a scratched cornea from playing a little hard and required surgery. I was stressed about what to do. I thought I could not take him to daycare while he recovered for surgery. He required extensive medications and needed to watched more closely in the cone of shame. The JHH team took care of Oliver post-op just as well as I would have at home. I never have to worry about my best friend while I am at work/class all day. I know he is being loved and played with as he is at home. I could not be more thankful for such incredible care of Oliver during his time of extra need. As a nurse, I am always caring for everyone else. I have been incredibly thankful to have someone help me out and give me peace of mind. Never bring your baby somewhere else! Sarah and her team are incredible. JHH is the best home away from home you can bring you furry friend to.

name: Abigail Martin
text: I have been trying to contact them for the last ten days after my dog was groomed here. I have called and emailed to no avail and have heard nothing back. I have many concerns with how well he was supervised the hours he spent here.

name: Drew Griffith
text: I took Buddy for grooming Savannah the groomer did a excellent job in grooming Buddy. Buddy smells wonderful.  He was full of matts when I dropped him off and know he is not. Savannah has done the best job of any grooming place I have ever talking buddy to

name: Kayla Rivera
text: They are wonderful with my dog. I have needed to leave before on fairly short notice and they have always been accommodating. My dog comes back happy. I will always feel comfortable leaving my dog there.

name: Anna Waters
text: I take my dog here once a week,  and he loves it. He hasn't always gotten along with other dogs, but he is so much more sociable now after a few months of weekly daycare. The staff at JHH is so nice and helpful, and I trust their judgment. Their services are also really affordable. I can't recommend them highly enough.

name: Cj Paxton
text: I have a giant breed dog ( Cane Corse  @ 160 lbs. )  Sarah and her crew have been great with him. He loves going there to play and hang out. No other place want to work with him because of his size. Wish I lived closer to them we moved and he isn't able to go now but I will have vacation soon. And he will be there for 12 days.

name: Raphael Cohen
text: Pasta and ambiance are both good. Great lunch place

name: Matthew Spivak
text: My dogs HATE getting groomed, but JHH was incredible! I could tell they genuinely cared for my boys and went the extra mile to make them feel comfortable. My dogs were in a much better mood when I picked them up compared to other places.

name: Stephanie Agee
text: It was okay I had to keep calling for the groomer, after she was reached I took my puppy in for a bath in a couple of days he was oily

name: LaBrena Friend
text: I have found out that Sarah is no longer at JHH. I will not be returning my dogs to JHH. I always knew my dogs were in the best care when Sarah was there and no longer trust that my dogs will be in good care without Sarah being there

name: mylilgigi2018 Mills
text:
Mrs Cole
Sorry you feel like this about JHH, but I can’t  imagine Sarah ever yelling at anyone her companion for what she does is above all.
The  dedication  she puts into running to JHH  is fabulous I wouldn’t put my baby anywhere else.

name: Bethany Cryder
text: Gracie loves her day care days.  I love the staff.  They treat her so wonderfully. Cannot recommend them enough.

name: Taylor Stroud
text: We have been taking our dog here for over a year now. She absolutely loves it. She gets excited whenever we ask her if she is ready "to go to daycare". They love taking care of our pup and do a great job. definitely recommend, especially those working close by at UAB and Children's

name: Terry Pribyl
text: Great service my dog loved the people. Kept my Lumpy for a day in a pinch, and didn't even charge us for the first visit.

name: Bryan Reed
text: Attended the Birmingham Bowl on the way home to Texas on a road trip.  I needed a place to keep our dog during the football game.  The folks at Just Happy Hounds were great.  My dog was actually sad to leave her newly acquainted canine friends.  I would highly recommend Just Happy Hounds!

name: mark gotfryd
text: The dog returned happy but lost weight. From being active all day or under fed??. She was returned with multiple bumps... insect bites... Flea?.. Gave her bravecto. The people are very very nice and obvious dog lovers...

name: Julie King
text: Friendly staff. 1st class care for your furbaby. Easy to find. Groomer does a great job. It's easy to get an appointment and prices are comparable to other less fancy places. There's a great vibe at Just Happy Hounds and I will continue to take my little beloved furbaby there! She got a groom that was precious but not as short as I needed for her comfort due to hotspots and they didn't hesitate to fix it for free. Great place!

name: Julie King
text: They do a good job and love my nany

name: Caywood Yamnik
text: I took my dog here for a year and a half and still they did not know her name, and called her a boy almost every time. The staff has very high turnover, and there seems to be a big internal communication issue.

name: Mark Reeder
text: Great way to get the extra energy out of our puppy plus learn socialization skills. Great place for boarding as well.

name: Kelly King
text:
I would like to say I’ve been to several doggie daycares and Just Happy Hounds by far is the BEST!!!!
You can really tell they care about your baby! I have to tell you about my experience with them today. I dropped my baby off for the first time today for her boarding I
was greeted by Sarah and Josh with warm welcomes. The others staff wanted to know exactly want Annabella need during her stay food, bath how much when. I have to say JHH has it together and I can tell Sarah is there because she loves the babies. Now I can go on my trip with no worries! Thank you JHH staff for all you do.

name: Shay Hoffman
text:
Very friendly staff however the groom on my Pomeranian wasn't quite up to snuff. I took him in at the end of March 2017 for an all over trim down to 1/2" (tail included), specific attention to his ears, and a sanitary cut.
The overall cut was uneven around his face, legs, and tail - it looked chunky, spots were missed and others cut too short. The sanitary cut was what I asked for but I noticed a razor burn/cut on the inside of his leg after we got home. They did a great job on his ears which is usually a tough spot so it seems odd that the other stuff was so spotty.
This groomer just doesn't seem to have the skill for my dog's coat or their prices. We won't be going back.

name: Leah Moseley Papp
text: My dog loves coming here and the staff is great.

name: Yashna Patel
text: My dog received an injury, it was hard to contact anyone who knew about the situation and management did not cooperate or empathize. My dog suffered a large bruise and blood spot on her back left leg. I had to call several times and finally got ahold of management. They did not find out how the injury happened and I finally had to take my dog to the vet. Also, I requested nail trimming while my dog boarded and they forgot to do so. I scheduled a drop off for my dog for boarding and no one was in the office to receive her though I let them know ahead of time. I definitely do not reccommend this place.

name: Dona Bonnett
text:
"We are so pleased with Just Happy Hounds Midtown.  The dog groomer did a fabulous job on Trouble, our 11 year old rescue dog and we definitely recommend Just Happy Hounds Midtown in Birmingham for anyone needing dog grooming, boarding, dog daycare or training. This is a wonderful new dog facility and the staff is great - thanks so much for taking such good care of my baby!  Dona Bonnett-adr Business & Marketing Strategies

We have had both of our dogs groomed several times and have been very pleased each time.  The dog groomers do a great job.  They are courteous and love the pups.  Copper loves to play at doggie daycare with the other dogs while he is at Just Happy Hounds.  I would highly recommend Just Happy Hounds!

name: Rachel Popwell
text: I have taken my Cocker Spaniel here for over a year now & we love it!

name: Cory Truett
text: Dog grooming did not come out well. I recommend going elsewhere.

name: Crystal Trinidad
text: Dog grooming is fairly priced and reliable

name: Anne Marie Miller
text: My pup pepper is beyond hyper!!! We do everything to wear her out! Every time she visits happy hounds she comes home tuckered out and happy!!! Forever a fan!!!!

name: Sarah Mills
text: At Just Happy Hounds they love them Like they are there own.....

name: Kyle Pérez
text: Not only do the folks at JHH really care for your pup like you would but their trainer, LaDale, is absolutely fantastic.

name: sandy lawrence
text: Horrible mangagement  fed my one year old lab a half cup of food for four days.   STAY AWAY

name: Jennifer Griffith
text: Poorly managed company with lots of issues that need to be worked out.  Would not recommend

name: Tracy Harris
text: Awful service. I would never go here.

name: Emily
text: Terrible management. DO NOT GO HERE.

name: Ashley Tate
text: The best doggy daycare EVER!!!!!!

name: Ravin Mooney
text: Love the staff at JHH!!!

name: Jeff Mills
text: Love, love, love JHH!

name: Alexis Ross
text: Best decision I could have made for my two German Shepherds was to get them trained through Iron Grip, they came highly recommended by someone from my veterinarian clinic. I worked with Dylan who my pets came to love. Dylan the dog whisperer, he’s knowledgeable on pet behaviors and tendencies and can advise you appropriately on what works or doesn’t work for your pet. My two dogs were disobedient in their own ways, I couldn’t walk them in my neighborhood but now I am able to do so calmly.  Having both dogs in one vehicle used to cause fights but now they’re calm and transports well. I could go on about the changes Dylan and Iron Grip has brought about with my two dogs but you don’t have the time. ☺️I fully recommend Iron Grip if you want to see changes in your dog behaviors,  get them trained with Dylan, it will be money well invested in your fur babies.

name: Florence Kerr
text: Our experience was very positive. We had a wish list of things we wanted Bailey training to incorporated. Dylan met all these and more. He gets our recommendations 100%. We are planning a trip and we will use Dylan for our boarding needs.

name: Nicole Halbrooks
text: Our Goldendoodle had a 4 week in kennel training with Dylan and he was able to address our major concerns with our new puppy.  She was jumping, nipping and overall not consistent with her commands until her training.  We now have the foundation and skills needed to have a well mannered dog.  I would recommend contacting Dylan for any training or behavior concerns.  Savannah also did a great grooming service for our doodle!  Thanks!!!

name: Tammy Wilkins
text: Scaring done to Kam while at Iron Grip Dog Training, and look how skinny he is..

name: Wendy Montealegre
text:
I really can't find the right words to truly express what an awesome trainer Dylan is. We had a problem dog named Balboa, honestly other trainers were reluctant to take him on. Balboa is a large Pit. Gorgeous and sweet, but also very untrained, reactive and strong. After Dylan got done with Balboa after 6 weeks, Balboa would sit, stay, heal. Honestly,  I didn't recognize him he was a totally different dog. Balboa was adopted by a very nice young man, and he is continuing Balboa's training.  Dylan spent time with the new adopter, helping to ensure a successful adoption.
Dylan worked with ANOTHER rescued dog named Percy.  We got out of a horrible situation.  Percy had been chained his entire life. He was totally unsocialized and scared of everything.  Also, he would get excited and nip, and play too rough.  We had very little hope for this poor boy.  After a few months with Dylan, AGAIN- completely different dog. Now- Percy is sweet, submissive, affectionate,  and very well behaved.   Percy will go to his forever home next week.   I honestly cannot believe how Dylan has been able to turn these forsaken,  troubled dogs around.  He is nothing short of a Miracle Worker.

name: Vicki Owens
text: Dylan has been the reason for our happy,  obedient puppy. I had reservations because I didn’t want to lose our playful baby. Dylan delivered to us the same playful yet trained puppy. We opted to board for four weeks and have been pleased with the results.

name: Holli Dorsett
text: Thank you Iron Grip for taking care of our girl while we were out of town! While there, she was taught sit, paw, and down. I also got updates and pictures which I loved! Would definitely recommend!

name: Tammy Wilkins
text: My experience  with Iron Grip Training  was horrible. My fiance  and I trusted Dylan with our beautiful and healthy  8mth old Cane Corso Kam for 4wks of training. That actually  turn into 5wks due to Dylan requesting more time due to him having drill and wanted to spend more time working with Kam.In reality  Dylan was trying to give Kam time to heal I guess. While Kam was away we constantly called and message  Dylan he never answered  our calls ,only a few for my fiance after he called and called each time the conversation were always breif but mostly him reassuring us Kam was safe,he was doing well and he was being properly cared for .We requested  pictures because I was worried only to receive 2blurry pics days later after request and  finally my fiance was able to get him to send 1tbat look like it was photoshop.Of course Dylan act as if no it was a prob with phone and Kam was being taken care of, he was his best puppy,and he loved him so much.On Saturday my fiance met with Dylan thoroughly Kam return.They had a heated discussion  because of the state of our puppy,  Kam looked like a rescue animal he lost so much weight ,how's that possible when we provided his food we even had food shipped to him to make sure he didn't run out.Kam has scars to his face and back.Patches of hair missing.I cried when I saw my baby, his spirit is so broken he's not even the same  animal that was once so happy and full of life.My puppy look and act as if he has been abused, he was house train and broken when he left not anymore. He hasn't learn any commands the exact same one's that he already  knew before leaving. The reviews Dylan business have can't be true ,I'm so disgusted  with how he treated Kam.As for the dogfights I'm sure Kam has been in ,Dylan had the nerves to say it was dog play.That  came from the many dogs he had on the yard .Today Kam has a visit with the Vet because I'm not sure of what kind of damage that has been done to him.And to get the many scaring he have checked and also to make sure that he's going to be okay due to the major weight loss. I'm trying to  figure how to add pictures to this review as proof.

name: Jaye Marlow
text: Amazing and worth the money. Very nice guy and very good at what he does. Has been tremendously  helpful with everything and has completely changed our ace.

name: Ella Sodhi
text: Dylan is a great trainer. Our dog has learned so much so fast.   We we would recommend him any time. He is extremely professional.

name: S Jordan
text: Dylan is very knowledgeable and has done a great job with our two rescues puppies!  He is caring and understanding of our Mira and her trust issues.  She is doing very well under his training. Milo loves his training sessions and is already understanding verbal commands.

name: Elizabeth Jones
text:
Dylan is very knowledgeable about dogs with tremendous insight concerning dog behaviors. He is personable, takes time to listen about our doggie’s specific needs, and is customer service oriented. We highly recommend him and trust him  with our special furry friends!

Krystel Jones

name: Latonya Finkley
text: Nice family business. Loved the grooming services provided by Savannah.

name: red life
text: Very Professional I am very Pleased with my Dog accomplishments thanks Dylan I will definitely recommend you for my dog needs

name: Kayla Charniaux
text: Good job boarding my dog

name: Bobbie Jo Ward
text: Dylan worked with our Yorkie through home visits and in-kennel. He went from a defiant, over active pup with little man syndrome to a well behaved and well mannered dog. Dylan not only taught Saban but also took the time to teach us how to effectively work with him as well. His training has made a huge improvement in Saban and in our home :)

name: arin allen
text: Dylan has been working with our Cane Corso puppy Fendi for about 5 weeks. He has been very good with responding to us regarding how she is doing. We also got to go visit her after 2 weeks to see what she has learned and she was doing great. That’s when we decided we would go ahead and let her get more training and do 6 weeks! We get to pick her up next week and are so excited to see how well she is doing!

name: Katherine S
text: Dylan at iron grip dog training is absolutely amazing! Dylan started training my German Shepherd puppy when he was a few months old. I started with a bundle of training sessions. These sessions went so well that I decided to have Dylan take my puppy for the in-house training for 4 weeks! My German Shepherd is truly an amazing and well-behaved dog. Dylan has been working with him on basic obedience, training commands, and hopefully soon we can start working on transitioning my German Shepherd to a service animal for my Autistic son. Dylan's fiancé provides exceptional grooming packages as well. This is a great company if you want to have a beautifully trained and groomed dog. I recommend him for anyone who wants quality dog training at a great price!

name: Georganne Canterbury
text: The folks at Dog U have done a great job with my Welsh Corgi puppy. She boarded and trained for a week with Calvin, who did a wonderful job training her to walk on a loose leash. Before her training, she was constantly pulling me and since her training, she behaves and is a joy to walk now. Their facilities are wonderful and my dog loves to go to daycare there. I especially like the different training and daycare packages they offer. It makes this investment much more affordable. I highly recommend Dog U for any training and/or daycare needs you might have. In my opinion, they are the best in town!

resp.text: Hi, Georganne. We are thrilled to learn that you had a positive experience with us!

name: Madison Williamson
text: We have taken our dog to Dog U for over 2 years. We initially did their one week training bootcamp and have continued with weekly daycare. The staff is so kind, attentive, and willing to answer any questions! Our dog is always happy to jump in the car and go when we ask if she wants to go to daycare. Andrea, Calvin, and Nick helped train her, and they were incredible. Gabe, Abby and the other staff members are some of the kindest! Our dog loves the Dog U team and so do we!

resp.text: Hi, Madison. We are thrilled to learn that you had a positive experience with us!

name: Bobbi Gould
text: We have taken our Akita to Dog U two different times now and our boy seems to have a good time while he is there. He comes home tired and usually a little damp. The crew there has shared with me that our dog really enjoys the kiddie pools during the recent warm weather. I love that they are so closely located  to our dogs vet. So I feel confident leaving my baby in  their care.

resp.text: Hi, Bobbi. We appreciate the kind words and are glad we could provide you with a positive experience!

name: Sarah Whaley
text:
We Love Dog U! We adopted our dog when he was 2 years old. We brought him in right away! We started with educational daycare which was a great way for him to socialize and learn basic commands. Now, he goes to daycare to socialize and stay active.

Everyone is very professional at Dog U, which is why we keep coming back! They know Cash by name and love him like he is their own! Dog U feels like family now and we recommend them to everyone.

resp.text: Hi, Sarah. Thanks for taking the time to share your positive experience. We truly appreciate it!

name: Ryan Ramage
text: Absolutely love this place!! Dog U changed our lab puppy in the week long training from driving my kids nuts to almost perfectly behaved!  I can loose leash walk her with ease and she loves going back to school to play with some friends!  I would highly recommend Dog U

resp.text: Hi, Ryan. We appreciate the kind words and are glad we could provide you with a positive experience!

name: Maria Vargas Morcilio
text:
I have a 5 month Yorkie  and Andrea has done an outstanding job with her. I have noticed her behavior at home has changed drastically, she is much better following commands.
I am so pleased with her progress that I have Enrolled Chanel for two more weeks.
The staff is very kind and always with a positive attitude,  it makes me feel good knowing that Chanel is well taking care of.

resp.text: Hi, Maria Vargas. Thanks for taking the time to share your positive experience. We truly appreciate it!

name: Amy Bradham
text: Please check out Dog U! My two puppies have experienced both the educational and regular daycare options; they come home tired and happy and I like the socialization they get with both humans and other dogs. The staff clearly enjoy working with dogs of all ages and sizes and it’s fun to watch the dogs waiting for their turns to be relayed inside. I recommend Dog U every opportunity I get.

resp.text:
Thank you so much for your kind words, Amy. We really appreciate you taking the time out to share your experience with us.

Cheers,

Dog U Birmingham

name: GandE2016 Thomas
text:
My family and I had bought a puppy from a breeder.  All we wanted in a dog is great behavior.  When we got our puppy, he was jumpy, mouthy, and generally a rambunctious puppy.
We sent Charlie to DogU for the 1 week undergrad training which conveniently coincided with a family vacation.  After 1 week, we got a totally different puppy — one that walks right beside us, hasn’t been mouthy and has generally great.  We haven’t even had the four follow-ups!

Thank u, DogU!

name: Heather Hinton
text: I LOVE Dog U Birmingham and so does my pup! The staff is just so friendly, helpful and accommodating - and they adore my dog (which makes my heart happy). For a few years I lived farther away and the trip to Dog U was a lot longer (with other daycares closer by) - but I chose to make the long trip every day and I would make that choice again. They are so good to me and my dog - I wouldn’t take him anywhere else!

resp.text: Hi, Heather. We appreciate the kind words and are glad we could provide you with a positive experience!

name: Jennifer Hood
text: Our dog always comes home from DogU happy, tired, and remembering her manners. We love the socialization and training she gets there and so does she. It’s so nice to have a place we can bring her for play, boarding, training, vet care and grooming where she has no anxiety getting out of the car. Everyone we interact with is friendly and helpful. Love DogU!

resp.text: Hi, Jennifer. Your feedback is highly appreciated. Thank you for the review!

name: Ellison
text: We have been going to DogU since my puppy was 4 months old.. Nnw Charleston is 3. He cannot get out of the car fast enough to go in! He loves this place! text: I cannot say enough wonderful things about Dog U.... let's put it this way:  they're the opposite of everything you don't like about your current doggie socialization center.  They obviously love what they do, their staff CARES, they have an equitable business model (don't try to reneg on their clients for paid-for days simply because of an arbitrary expiration policy), they ....answer the phone!  Yes!  A live, cheerful human answers the phone when you call!  I'm so blessed to have found out about Dog U.  🥳🥳🥳

text: We have been students at Dog U for 8 months and just signed up for another six months of continuing education.  We enjoy all the people there and my dog looses it when she realizes where we are.

name: Amanda Rafferty
text:
We picked up our 4 month old German Shepherd puppy Wednesday afternoon only to notice that something was off about his eyes. As soon as the staff member brought him out, I could see how red and swollen his eye was. I asked if something happened and they stated no. They repeatedly acted like they could not see anything wrong with his eye until I kept insisting that it was not right (very bright red, bloodshot, swollen and bulging). He has bursted blood vessels in both of his eyes.

I still do not understand how this could happen to a dog that was in EDUCATIONAL daycare. If he is on a slip leash, he should have someone who is a trainer with him; someone who could (and should) have corrected any behavior that could have caused this to happen.

resp.text: Hi, Amanda. At Dog U Birmingham, we aim to provide positive experiences at all times. Is there anything we could do to make it better? Please call us at (205) 967-3648!

name: Maya Pace
text:
I love bringing my fur baby, Sophie, to Dog U. She has so much fun playing with the other dogs. I also get to see pictures of her on Facebook playing with other dogs, which is a big plus for me.
I told the owners that Dog U is like a Disney World for dogs 😊. I also like that I can request doggy ice cream for my fur baby during her visits.
The staff at Dog U are very courteous, friendly, and professional. I feel at ease leaving my Sophie in Dog U care. I would definitely recommend Dog U to anyone looking for a great place to bring their fur babies. I absolutely ❤️ Dog U!!!!

resp.text: Hi, Maya. Your feedback is highly appreciated. Thank you for the review!

name: Meredith Parker
text: I trust Dog U completely with the care of my two dogs, Lady (2 years old) and Maggie (12 years old). Lady was a 6-month old puppy when she was first introduced to Calvin and Andrea. Lady has attended intensive day care and group classes, and I do not have the words to express the positive changes in Lady’s behavior through working with Calvin and Andrea. Through group classes, I have seen first-hand Calvin’s knowledge, patience, and passion for dogs and their well-being. In addition, Lady and Maggie attend regular day care and always come home happy and tired from a full day of play! I also have the peace of mind that their amazing vets are on-site, and I have the convenience to add-on grooming/baths/vet services all in one place. There is no better place for my dogs than Dog U!

name: pedro martinez
text: We are really pleased with this place

name: McCall Rizzo
text: Love this place! Great trainers and staff. Super professional and great with our dogs!

name: Jordan Anderson
text:
Called Vicki and got all the information and pricing for our 2 acres of Invisible Fence. She was very straightforward about how everything would work and what the pricing would be...not a penny more or less. The day they scheduled my installation there was inclement weather on the horizon, but they got right to work and got my fence installed in the pouring rain and wind! They went over training with me under the cover of our carport and everything with the fence worked great.

About 2 weeks after my installation, I broke a bolt on my ZTR mower while cutting grass and a brace on the front of the deck drug on the ground for a few minutes before I realized it, cutting through two places in my 2-week-old invisible fence underground. I promptly called Vicki and told her what happened. This was on a Saturday. On Tuesday, they came back to my house and repaired to 2 breaks in the fence at no charge.

The level of service here is unparalleled. They get the highest marks from me! Very, very satisfied customer here. Would HIGHLY recommend!!!

name: Louise Hampton
text: We have had invisible fence for many years. We love it our two dogs and two cats have freedom with safety. We know the can only roam in the area we have provided within the fence. Follow up for the batteries is good. Keep your local dealers number as if you look up invisible fence it goes to a generic 1800 number.

name: Sissy Thomas
text: Just got this system installed at our home in Florida. It is FLAWLESS! We have three rowdy Aussies and didn’t think anything could contain them. This DID, they have 3 acres to romp, they are beautiful happy pups now. Now having it installed for my son and his lab GG.

I would recommend Invisible Fence of Mtg
to anyone that owns  dog. My dogs will not leave the boundary of the fence even when not wearing their collar. I have had several dogs killed on the highway in past years, so I am so happy to have this fence.

name: Michael White

Trevor is a true professional.  We were only successful because of him!  I cannot say enough about how great of an instructor he is.

For those who want to support those who served our country, call Rocket City K9.  Semper Fi from an old Army Soldier

name: Ashley Dowd
text: Highly recommend!! I contacted Rocket City K9 to set up puppy training for our new Cane Corso puppy Dozer. Trevor got us on his schedule immediately and we hit the ground running the day after we brought him home. It has been YEARS since we have had a puppy, so we wanted get get set up for success. Dozer presented us with some unexpected challenges, and Trevor helped us through them all. I am extremely pleased with Dozer's progress in this first 6 weeks of training we have done so far. With Trevor's guidance, we feel more confident to handle our newest addition. Thank you, Trevor and Rocket City K9!!

name: Lisa Steele
text: Trevor was absolutely wonderful with my 15 week miniature Dachshund, Callie. He addressed all of my concerns and needs with my new puppy. He also taught me the methods I needed to continue working with her on a daily basis. He was very thorough and even helped us socialize her by taking us on an outing to the local outdoor mall. Thank you so much Trevor! Callie will miss you and all of your rewards (treats and playful scratches).

resp.text: So glad I could help! You have a very special pup, little Callie dog might be the cutest dog ever!!

resp.text: Thank you very much for the kind words Sandy!  Ginger is a special girl and we're very happy we were able to help you develop a stronger relationship with her.

text: Rocket City K-9 helped us so much with our dog, Weezer. His anxiety was getting worse and leading to fear-aggression. The training helped Weezer with his anxiety and Trevor taught us the skill sets we need to maintain, and continue, his greatly improved behavior. We feel so fortunate that we found Rocket City K-9. Our family of dogs, and humans as well, are ready to take on anything!

resp.text: Thank you so much Tiffany, y’all and Weezer boy were great!

name: Laurie Womeldorph
text: From the moment we met Sean, we had no doubt that he would be an amazing trainer. With his expertise and background, we knew that having our German Shepherd in his board and train program would be the best decision we ever made. She has been a fantastically trained and very well behaved dog.

resp.text: Thank you so very much Laurie!  Loved your family and I hope all is well with everyone.

name: Brian Lynch

The trainers at RCK9 have impressive backgrounds and track records. They are both highly skilled and patient. Their responses to my questions have always been prompt, candid, and extremely helpful. I highly recommend RCK9.

Edit: 1/18/2020 - RCK9 evaluated, acquired, and trained the perfect family protection dog for us. They far exceeded expectations and even arranged for an Xmas Eve delivery to surprise our 5 year old son. Their ongoing support and handler training have been great as well.

Pamela, Demi, Darbie and Bella

name: paulo maurtua
text: Amazing trainers. Work with you on any issue you may have. These guys were beyond knowledgeable pretty impressed.
