name: Bill Gaskins
text: I've know Sean for many years. His knowledge, passion, and patience to understand dogs is top notch. He will differentiate training to train the dog you have to become the dog you want.

resp.text: Thanks Bill.  It's been great knowing you over all these years.  "Miss your face!"

name: Elliott Bender
text:
We have a Catahoula named Ava. She is smart, loyal and can be extremely independent.  We completed our off leash advanced obedience course last week and it was worth every dollar.  I now feel comfortable handling my dog off leash in any setting.  We had a bunch of highlights during training. There were two that stuck out above the rest. One, I can now recall Ava to heel when she is chasing prey off leash. Two, she now performs a modified heel when I ride my bike without a leash on. She follows me at a distance of 5 ft.  The ability to control my dog while mt biking is truly incredible.

Why would I choose RCK again?  Simple, both Sean and Trevor are masters of their craft. Each session builds on the last. They give simple instructions and give doggie homework. If you choose RCK you and your dog will become closer then you ever could have imagined.  If you are considering dog training choose RCK, they are the best.

resp.text: Thank you so very much for being such an active and engaged owner. You and Ava were an absolute joy to work with and we're looking forward to seeing you continue to grow and advance together.

name: Sherri Trowbridge
text: Sean Lulofs trained my German Shepherd Jack, who I adopted from the Military Working Dog (MWD) school. We were unsure how Jack would be with our cat and our grandkids. Having Sean, a former MWD handler, trainer and MWD Program Manager could not have been a better fit for our situation. He was able to assess Jack's aggressiveness, prey drive, and train-ability and we now have a trained, reliable, perfect family dog that we had hoped for. His ability to read and work with dogs and just as important, also train the owner, is like no other.

resp.text: Jack was so great to work with.  Loved that coat on him, so fluffy compared to most GSDs.  My favorite part is the way he learned to get along with your gorgeous cat.  The picture of your granddaughter and Jack is one of my favorites and see it every once in awhile.

name: Brantley Wilson
text: I am new to the Daphne area and chose the Dog Ranch based on proximity to my house as well as the wonderful customer reviews. My dog was groomed at the Dog Ranch, and they did a wonderful job! However, my dog was diagnosed with Kennel Cough one week after getting groomed. This is the first time this has happened to my dog, but it makes me hesitant to return.

name: Connie Cummings
text: My Basset Hound has been going here for 4 months and we absolutely love it, the staff are friendly, and professional, we use grooming for his nails very often and find they do a great job. I love getting feedbacks about how his day has been and whom he played with, when we pick him up, he is sometimes muddy and dirty, this just shows me that he had a great time playing. My pup loves coming here to play, no complaints on our end.

name: Stacey Kulp
text: Absolutely astonishing establishment! My dog gets excited just going to the car these days assuming this is where she's going & she can even tell when we don't make the turn. We would never take Millie elsewhere. Dog Ranch Resort is unbelievable in every aspect.

name: Brandy Morrison
text: I love that the dogs don't pace in a small area. My dog is always exhausted when we go home.

name: jesse olive
text: My dog loves this place! He gets to play a lot and comes home tired but happy.

name: Kassidy Ferrie
text: I had never taken my dog, Bardi, to daycare before and was super nervous about it. Bardi takes some time to warm up to other people but after 2 days of daycare at the Dog Ranch I could tell she LOVED it. All of the staff are friendly and professional and you can tell they love dogs! We also took Bardi to the puppy training class at Dog Ranch Too with Ben (the owner) and he was so helpful. If you’re looking for daycare/boarding for you dog this place is the best!!

name: James Kretz
text: Never been , but I hear that this place is great 👍

name: Ray Hudson
text:
Delilah loves Dog Ranch Resort. Especially Doggy Daycare, the entire staff is exceptional, no matter if she is being groomed, boarded or being trained.  There is a great Comfort to know they  really care about my baby girl.
I really appreciate that.

name: Tera McGill
text: Absolutely horrible business!  I had my dogs booked to be boarded while we went on vacation.  They had already been to the facility a couple weeks beforehand to be tested and spent a whole day there and passed the test.  I brought them on the morning we were leaving and before I finished filling out paperwork they brought my dogs back to me and told me they could not keep them because one was being aggressive.  This was 4 hours before our flight was scheduled to leave.  I asked what was the purpose of the test, why didnt they figure this out then?  It was absolutely ridiculous. I had to make last minute arrangements and it almost ruined our vacation.

resp.text: We are sorry for any inconvenience we may have caused you. Dog Ranch Resort is a dog social environment where all dogs are interacting with one another in some capacity. We do a Temperament Test and Trial Day to give your dogs an opportunity to acclimate into our daycare environment. Most of the time we are able to catch if your dog is a good fit or not. It is not uncommon for a dog to get worse during future visits. They did significantly worse when they came to board. When introduced to the group they were snapping and growling at the other dogs. For the safety of your dogs and all of the other dogs we made the decision to remove them from the group. If your dogs are reacting in a way that jeopardizes the safety of everyone else, it is our policy that they be removed from group and sent home. Safety comes first at Dog Ranch Resort.

name: Kathleen Taupeka
text: WOW! Our furry babies LOVED the Dog Ranch. You are greeted with red carpet service as soon as you pass through the gate. The staff is so friendly and are truly happy to see you and your pups! It's clean and organized and oh so spacious!! You get some amazing photos of all the dogs having the time of their lives!!! We know our babies are in good, loving hands here!!! Give your Dogs a TREAT!!!

name: Josh Bradford
text: My dog has gone here for over 4 yrs.  His care & training is exemplary due to the excellent trainers & Ben Schulman.  I trust Ben implicitly.  Ranch hands are friendly, & professional.  My fur babies love this place & are exhausted when they get home.

name: Crystal Anderson
text: This place is the best place ever to take your pet.  No hassle.  Dog actually wants to go inside! For the first time ever!

name: Haley
text: My dog loves this place!! He always comes home exhausted and I love the Facebook photos they post, so I can see my pup while he's there.

name: Gary Knutson
text: Wonderful doggie daycare, boarding, grooming and training.  Our dogs love this place and the staff.  Maggie and Sadie cannot wait to go there.  We are happy to find a place where we can leave our dogs worry free.  We have boarded them 5 times now for up to a week each time.  Grooming charges are very reasonable for our 2 chocolate labs. 2 thumbs up and five stars to Ben and his staff.

name: Keith Hobbs
text: Top notch place. Very professional and caring. Highly recommend this business.

name: Jessie Quarterman
text: The Best place for your four legged family members to stay or to get a lovely pampering!

name: Megan McKinzie
text: I had previously used Dog Ranch for boarding many times and loved them, but because it had been a year since I last used their services they refused to let me bring my dogs in for day care or to let me board them over the thanksgiving holiday even though spaces were available because and I quote "I am not a valued customer" and services are only available  to their "valued customers".  Their customer service has clearly gone down hill and I am sad to report due to how I was treated by staff I will NEVER use their services again. I cannot support a business that does not value all their customers, not just their regular ones. Disgraceful.

name: Kacey Cook
text: Weve been customers of The Dog Ranch for over 3 years up until today.  Ever since the new administration at the front desk took over, the service has been awful.  I made an appointment for grooming over a week ago, which at that time, I was confirmed  to bring my dog in.  I’ve ALWAYS been hesitant to use their groomer- they really aren’t known for their grooming services but wanted to try them.  They called last night at 6 pm to confirm the appointment and asked me to make sure vet records were faxed over. I questioned why they hadn’t called the vet for them. It’s after hours!  I NEVER had to do that as the staff always did this for us. No biggie, right?   I called the vet this morning, they informed me the Dog Ranch had already called and they received the documents yesterday.  So I called the Dog Ranch as I was walking out of my house to verify they received them.  Apparently they KNEW my dog wasn’t eligible for grooming YESTERDAY but never told me last night when they confirmed his appointment.  When I questioned them on this I was totally blown off and directed to Email the owner with my concerns. Ok, I get it!  I’m 4 days past due on a vaccination. But they knew this yesterday morning!  No call to let me know. Nothing!  Ever since Carly left, the Dog Ranch service has been horrible. I will NEVER be back with our dogs. Common courtesy was avoided. This relationship is over.

resp.text: Mrs. Cook, We are sorry to hear you are so disappointed about your experience. However, it is our policy that all dogs be up to date with our required vaccinations. As we stated over the phone several times, Bentley did not have his vaccines current. Please understand this is a necessary safety precaution we take with all clients due to the high volume of dogs we see every day. When you sign our release form you state that your dog is up to date with their vet records upon arrival at our facility. We are not a veterinarian and can not administer vaccines. It is your responsibility to ensure that your dog is current on all vaccines upon arrival. Please understand that pet safety is our number 1 concern. There are many other grooming options in our area to try. We wish you the best of luck.

name: Lauren Lavender
text: They do a fantastic job with taking care of our furry friends! Our dog gets so excited everytime we arrive and is always so sad to leave!

name: dave rotach
text: After a lengthy move we needed to find someone that we could trust with our fur babies,  the Dog Ranch has fit the bill for us. We have boarded two dogs for a week at a time, a couple times. My  fur kids come home like I used to come home from summer camp. They want to sleep for a week. They are super excited every time we come back to the Dog Ranch for either grooming or another stay.

name: Brenden Tarver
text: Trustworthy an awesome staff. To watch over our fur babies.

name: nicawi46
text:
I have to definitely agree with the reviewer  regarding Dog Ranch’s poorly delivered temperament test. At least, because I saw that review, I was not so shocked when they brought her out within less than two minutes and said “she failed.” The test, as the ranch dude explained, involved taking her into a room, on a leash, where there was already a dog; so she did what I could’ve told you she would do—she barked & cried at the dog.  You definitely have to know what you’re doing if you’re going to introduce dogs on a leash. These guys certainly don’t. When I got there, he just called over the loud speaker “Bring Jackson [their test dog] into room [blah, blah, blah];” then he took my dog on a leash all the sudden and in approximately two minutes he came back out saying that my dog just “snapped at the other dog the whole time.”

My dog definitely barks and cries when on a leash when she sees other dogs—she wants to do what’s natural to her (sniff the other dog’s butt and go play). However, she does well, on or off the leash, meeting other dogs if properly introduced.  I’ve boarded my dog before in several places; she’s had dog sitters and even walkers that come to pick her up with other dogs;  I’ve have always been told how sweet she is with other dogs—those other places probably know more about dog behavior than these guys.  I take my dog to different dog parks regularly and I see myself that she does well with other dogs in her own terms or with me guiding her if needed.

I didn’t really care in the end whether they accepted or not.  It’s their loss in the end. They turned away a perfectly sweet dog and loss hundreds of dollars plus future business. I was looking to board for 11 days while I’ll be in Europe and then again later this summer for a shorter trip.  It’s their loss, not mine.  And if they have no record of my being there—well I did take my intake sheet after they failed my dog so why would you have my info? I called to verify my appointment the day before, though,  so I would certainly hope that they have some record that my dog was there and was “failed,” lol!!

resp.text:
The Dog Ranch Resort is a dog social environment, our temperament test dog has met over 3000 dogs of various sizes, and breeds. Our process is proven to work and is comparable to doggy daycares around the country. The reason we use a leash is to simply get your dog back into the temperament test room. Once your dog gets back there they are simply free to sniff one another.

However, your dog did not want to interact and showed extreme signs of separation anxiety. When Jackson attempted to approach she snapped at him. Due to the fact that she was anxious and reacted in an aggressive manner shows that this environment would be too stressful for her. If she can not handle meeting one dog then it is not fair to subject her to a pack of dogs and jeopardize the safety of our other clients. Safety is our number one priority, there are many other wonderful options in Baldwin county for your pet. We are happy to address your concerns over the phone at any time. You may reach us at 251-929-4899.

name: Matt Mullis
text:
Have taken my husky once recently for grooming services. Staff was very friendly and eager to help. The groomer sat on the floor with my nervous dog until she was comfortable enough to go back. The quality of the work was excellent. The building appears to be TOO plush, IMO. I get what their intentions are but it seemed like over kill (aesthetically). Pricing was slightly higher than what we used to pay by the quality was above expectations. Will absolutely be back.

Would suggest that location possibly partner with local vet to offer same day services like check ups, shots and minor treatments. Anything more involved could be handled elsewhere.

text: My dog loves it here. They take good care of her.

name: Fletcher Wright
text: Dog Ranch Resort in Daphne is literally a horrible place for a dog. My dog boards at Camp Scotty in Pelham sometimes and it is awesome. I saw the Dog Ranch Resort website and it looked similar. I visit Fairhope help my Mom who has Parkinson's and at times I need a place to board Bailey while here. There were unfriendly on the phone, and very business-centric, not customer-centric, and certainly not dog lovers. I arrived with my 3 year old Cockapoo, immediately heard someone yelling at an employee to keep the dog behind the line??  Then a woman walked briskly up to us, said I have to take her for the "temperament test", took my dog before she was comfortable or acclimated, came back 5 minutes later and said "Your dog was very frightened of our test dog. Sorry she cannot board here, we have lots of big dogs." So I said "let me get this straight, you immediately (in an unfriendly way) take a young dog away from its owner, walk down the hall, open a door where a large Doberman is waiting and because she gets scared you won't take her?" I also explained that she has boarded plenty of times and does great. I even offered the phone number of the place she boards. The woman says "Sir, your dog failed the temperament test."  All I can say in summary is that NO person or place that knows ANYTHING about dogs would design THAT as it's temperament test.  One more thing: I have my data analyst at work check out the reviews and he stated that all but about 3 are bogus owner generated.

resp.text: We are sorry you had a bad experience however, we have no record of your dog coming and visiting our facility. Everything you have described seems off. The Dog Ranch Resort is a very dog social environment and it is suited for active social dogs. All of our dogs are out in separate groups socializing with one another and they are supervised by our ranch hands. We do not just throw dogs in a dog run or a crate. Our Temperament Test Dog is a Chocolate Lab and not a Doberman. Everyone who meets him sees how calm, easy going, and sweet he is. The way our temperament test works is we want to make sure that your dog is good with a new person, a new dog, in a new place while the parents are away. Since you will be leaving your dog in our care we want to make sure that they are okay without you. What we look for is any signs of aggression, anxiety, and overall temperament of your dog. If they show any signs of aggression then our facility can not accommodate a dog that could be potentially dangerous to the other dogs. If we see a lot of fear and anxiety we always suggest a trial day to allow your dog to get acclimated to our environment. We want to make sure your dog is as comfortable as possible prior to boarding. It is also our policy that a "Temp Test" be done at least 2 days prior to boarding in order to allow for a trial day if necessary. Boarding your dog in a new place is very stressful for a lot of dogs so we try to take all of the necessary precautions to make sure that they aren't too overwhelmed. Before jumping in a pool most people test the water, that is the way our temperament test is designed. Our receptionist are required to treat everyone with respect, integrity, and kindness.

text:
Our dog, Piper, was a completely different dog in just the few hours that Theresa was in our home. Having a less stressed dog who listens and knows who is in charge is going to make a world of difference in our home. In just a few hours, she was responding so different than what we have been used to for the last six months. We were at our wits end with her behaviors and in the few hours Theresa was here to help me work with her I could tell a difference in her anxiety level and her behavior. I was able to go in my kitchen without a dog under my feet, answer the door without her coming too, walk her on a loose leash without her pulling in front of me. The results were amazing. Theresa will be back in a month and we will continue to work with her everyday at home to see a dramatic difference in our sweet dog. After a few hours of training she is worn out and sleeping peacefully in our living room, which would have never happened before.

I am so glad we sought some extra help with Theresa from BarkBusters! We truly couldn’t have done it without her. She is so patient and kind. We never would have gotten this with other forms of training we looked into!

name: Brittany Howard
text:
Theresa has been working with my sister and her dog, Sophie, for over a month now and the experience has been great. We saw tremendous improvements in Sophie's behavior after just the first session, and over the next month it continued to improve. Sophie has developed anxiety and we're still working on keeping her calm when neighbors walk past the apartment, but when something hasn't worked, Theresa has always had another method to try.

We chose to work with Bark Busters because they claim to use positive reinforcement and better communication rather other less pleasant methods like shock collars. Sophie is a sweet dog who has a strong bond with us and we didn't want to hit or mistreat her. Theresa shares that mindset and the Bark Busters methods really have deepened our bond with Sophie.

I also really appreciated that Theresa invited me to attend the training sessions even though Sophie belongs to my sister and my sister is paying for the training (not me). But because I keep Sophie during the day while my sister is at work, Theresa knew I would be spending a lot of time with Sophie. Consistency is really important to make these techniques work, and having attended the training sessions, I can work with Sophie at home during the day, which has helped our progress.

Finally, lots of people claim to love dogs, but you can tell quickly that Theresa really does care about the clients she works with. If something isn't working, she doesn't force it. She's patient and she tries to tailor what she does to the dog and family she works with. Working with her has been a great investment.

resp.text: Thank you Brittany. Sophie is a sweet dog. We will keep working on her till she is happy and you guys too.

name: Chris Kearns
text:
Theresa came highly recommended by the Lee County Humane Society when I asked them for help with our family dog that had bitten one of the children.  After we decided to work together, she sent me some information to get me prepared for our first meeting.  Even though she was greeted at the door with loud barks and bared teeth, she kept her cool and within about 1 hour he was eating out of her hand.  I was impressed, but the real work was yet to come.

She walked me through several different exercises/activities to recondition his behavior and train me to set the tone for what was expected in the house and out on walks, and gave me some equipment to use while training.  While neither I nor Bodie were perfect right away, the progress was astounding.  She recapped each of the activities with me before she left, and I felt very confident in 6 or 7 of the 8, but that's ok.  Part of the package she sent me later was a detailed action plan for the first 4 weeks, including a checklist for the daily activities we are supposed to practice, and a reminder on what I was supposed to do with each one.  OK!

Even now just a day or two after Theresa has started with us, this dog is the best behaved it's ever been. He used to bark in my face every time I would get dressed because he knew I was going out somewhere and there was a chance he could go on a car ride or a walk.  He also used to crowd me in the kitchen while I was making dinner or getting his food ready or his treats ready.  But one of the early things she taught me was how to hold a space in the kitchen to work when I want, and to let him in during normal times.  I decided to test that right after she left by making myself a peanut butter and jelly sandwich. Normally when he smelled peanut butter he was *right in there* hoping to get some for himself but this time he stood patiently about six feet away, and just watched until I called him and I was finished. It was the same thing for filling his food bowls and stuffing his toys with treats. Amazing!!  I cannot tell you how much more enjoyable it is to get dressed in the morning and come downstairs and put my shoes on and have a breakfast without a dog barking in my face the whole time because he expects to go for a walk or go for a ride.  He's still there next to me happy as ever, he's just not barking!

We're still working on the "loose leash" walking techniques, and it seems weird to have to correct him all the time instead of letting him wander around, but he's starting to figure it out, and that means less corrections.  Honestly it's better exercise for both of us when he does it correctly because we keep a good pace. He still gets to pee and poop and enjoy the outside, but we actually get moving well enough to get some real exercise, and it's much more enjoyable and less strain my back if he's not pulling the whole time.

I'm excited to see how far Bodie and I can take this training, we're both learning at the same time.  I feel like I made the right decision to hire Theresa with Bark Busters, and I look forward to showing her how much progress we've made by the next time we all get together.  Thank you for making my dog more fun to be around, and safer too.  I can't tell you how much it means, but you saw it on my face.  I WISH we had done something like this earlier.

If your dog is running your house, and/or sometimes out of your control, please do something about it - call Theresa and get some help.

resp.text: Thank you Chris. It is a pleasure to work with you and Bodie. You are on your way to making Bodie a happier dog and you too!

name: Sandra Jones
text: Last September we adopted a German Shepard named Soldier. We had no clue what we were getting into. This dog jumped, barked, pulled, mouthed, and had no manners. He had high anxiety when my son went to work and you could forget approaching the car when he was in it. One night he pulled me down onto the ground, jumped on my daughter and that was a wake up call. I knew that Tressia from Bark Busters had worked with several dogs at the humane society, so desperately I gave her a call. After explaining our situation, Tressia assured me that she could help. We saw a huge difference in his behaviors after the first session. We learned that Soldier believes that he's the leader of the pack when he shouldn't be. name: MARIA ALVAREZ
text: I took my puppy here today attempting to get her boarded for the weekend. I was told she would have a 60 min assessment to insure she was not aggressive. I called 90 min later after not hearing from them to be told I would get a call within an hour. Almost 3 hours later I got a call saying they could not accept her because of her anxiety and shyness and they only partially did the assessment. They requested I socialize her more so she loses her fear of people. She has been around about 100 people in a week… this was a complete waste of my day. I luckily have found another boarder with short notice.

resp.text:
Hi Maria,

We are so sorry that you had a negative experience with the temperament test, we always strive to meet incredibly high customer service standards and apologize if we fell short. I know that you mentioned Lunita sees lots of people all the time, but a daycare situation can be a very different environment for a dog. She was clearly overwhelmed and nervous from the beginning and even with more time to adjust it was clear that she would not thrive in a group play environment. Our temperament test is designed to not only ensure that a dog does not pose a risk to the rest of the pack but it also helps us determine if this type of daycare/boarding is the best environment for your pup. Just like people, some dogs find different situations more stressful or enjoyable than others.

When we determine that a pup might not be a good fit, we generally have a manager call to provide a thorough explanation and offer recommendations. With the additional protocols currently in place to protect our clients and staff, it sometimes it gets a little more hectic and we apologize that you did not feel assured in our assessment.

I am so glad that you found a place to board Lunita! We wish you and your pack the best, and please let us know if you would be interested in continuing this conversation.

text: We Talk Dog is an awesome place! I was a training client about a year and a half ago and now I work here as a handler. Adam is an awesome trainer and seriously made my life and my dog's life so much better! This is truly the best job I have EVER had. I can assure you that no one that comes in to the business is treated like Matthew has stated and I am sure of that. As for the poop in the floor, dogs will be dogs but we are always very prompt in cleaning up their messes and we work very hard to keep our facility clean. A temperament test is required for ALL daycare or boarding clients and that is for the safety of our handlers and our pups! We are very busy and sometimes the next available appointment for a temperament test can be a month out simply because we have a lot of people who want their pup in daycare! We love our clients and especially their pups! In the morning when our daycare/grooming/boarding clients come in we all know their names and are excited to see them! Believe me these dogs get loved on all day! We would certainly NEVER discriminate against a dog for the way it looks.  If you want to see what our clients really think please visit the We Talk Dog Facebook page!

name: Beverly M
text: I love WTD! Their daycare is the cheapest in town BUT they are also the best quality in town, which is important to me because of my limited budget. My rescue, Lilith, had some behavioral issues which have been completely eliminated since she started daycare once a week. The staff is friendly and attentive. I would recommend them to anyone!

name: Lauren Thompson
text: We love WTD! Everyone there knows my pug by name and the people there are so sweet and loving! I even get social media updates throughout the day and get to see the dogs having a blast! Great great place - would absolutely recommend. Bruce LOVES IT!!

resp.text: We LOVE Bruce! Thank you for letting us care for him!

name: TA Tipton
text:
Having a physically challenged best buddy - a small white and apricot spotted, twelve year old,  Shi-poo, it has been difficult to find someone who will groom him. He doesn't have full function from mid-spine and back. To my dismay and disappointment, more than one request to have him groomed has been denied by other businesses in the area, so I did what I could with my own "custom" scissor cut. But, "We Talk Dog" didn't give a second thought; they took him right away and their groomer did a superb job. He looks great!!! Typically, Ted has some anxiety at being handed to someone for care. Not a whimper! He knew he was in good hands.

The staff flocked around him (all of which he soaked up like a furry sponge) - even the owner makes the point of greeting Teddy whenever he goes for grooming. The groomer knows what she is doing, and has worked with dogs who have physical issues, so I have 100% confidence in this group of giving, caring people. Our next step is for Ted to have a play date there. Buckled in his cart (chariot), he can run with the best of them. Thanks, "WE TALK DOG"!!!!!!     Tim - a Huge fan

name: Katie Kimbrell
text: Very impressed! Staff went above and beyond - even sending me directly a picture of my dog playing and telling me he was happy and loved. They regularly posted pictures on social media allowing me to see that G was doing just fine while we we were gone. I highly recommend WTD.

name: GIS Specialist
text: When my Cora was little I thought I had socialized her enough. I was wrong my mixed breed puppy was scared to the point of shaking when she was around more than one dog that was not part of her home pack. She is a timid shy dog but after some hard work and awesome socialization at WTD she began to play and loved We Talk Dog. I eventually started to work there and found that the people there not only care for your dogs but have a true passion in doing so. Though I do not work there now, which a large part of me still wants to be, I have absolutely no hesitation in leaving my dog with the wonderful people here who insure that she is well fed, healthy, and plenty of time to play with her friends. I cannot express how amazing this place is so I just suggest that you go and see for yourself you will not be disappointed!!

name: jamey cash
text:
I have used We Talk Dog for years and have nothing but good things to say about the staff.  Adam is amazing and his facility is the best around.  I live over 20 miles away from his facility, but any time I need to board my dog, I take her to We Talk Dog. Even though there are five vets that offer boarding within 5 miles of my house, his facility is the only one I trust.

The thing I love most about WTD, is the fact that he has someone on site 24/7.  Your dog will never be left unattended or just “locked up” in kennel all day.  They are always playing and socializing with a great amount of supervision during the day, and at night, they have spacious kennels and someone is always staying with them.

As far as training goes, Adam helped us tremendously.  We have a German Shepherd that was starting to become fear aggressive until Adam worked with her.  He spent hours walking us through the steps to get her back on track and left us with a plan.  It was hard work, but we did everything he said.  Now, three years later, we have the most amazing dog we could have ever hoped for.  Adam is still one of our dog's favorite people in the world, and she gets so excited every time we pull in his parking lot she can barely stand it!

Overall, We Talk Dog is an amazing, clean, organized and well looked after facility, and the training is outstanding.  I think some people want a trainer to come out and "fix" their dog for them, but that can't be done.  The owner of the dog must be trained how to train the dog, and no one does this better than Adam and his staff.
I would recommend We Talk Dog's boarding and training to anyone.

name: Cassundra Shaw
text: My dog was so excited to go back after her 2 hour assessment. That it made me happy to take her. The staff was professional and nice.

name: Kelsey Brock
text: Our dog loved it there and was always well cared for by the staff.  We recently switched daycare facilities due to the over-crowding and frequent inability to register our pup to attend daycare on certain days.   Very frustrating to have to reserve a simple doggie daycare drop off days in advance to get a spot.  Especially when the purpose of doggie daycare is to meet the needs of a busy family.  Luckily WTD refunded our package.

resp.text:
Thanks so much for your feedback and for entrusting your pup with WTD. One of the things WTD is known for is putting dog safety as our number 1 priority. During peak boarding times such as Spring Break, we unfortunately have to close daycare to ensure the health and happiness of all the dogs in our care. We hate to do this but are unwilling to compromise our strict standards of care. When we know that daycare will be closed we send out an email blast, post flyers around WTD, and share it on Facebook weeks in advance. We hope that this helps people plan accordingly, and we are sorry that you did not receive those notifications. We will definitely be looking into additional ways to keep folks in the loop as we never want someone to feel frustrated with our services.

We are sorry that WTD was not the right fit in the end for you and your pup! Thanks again for the honest feedback and we wish you the best of luck!

name: Caitlin Dinken
text: The staff at We Talk Dog is fantastic! They go out of their way to make sure that your dog is happy and taken care of. My dog absolutely loves getting to play all day and comes home happy and exhausted every time!

name: Rebekah Brophy
text: These people are wonderful.  They always take great care of my doggie and they are extremely responsive and informative.  They treat their clients like family.

name: Polly Mitella Goins
text: Taking care of friend's dog.  Dog seems happy.

name: Brian W. Kittrell
text: Knowledgeable  and very caring staff.  I feel as if my dog is at home here.

name: Laura Wainwright
text: I cannot say enough positive things about WTD!!  The facility is great for the dogs and the staff is fabulous!!  One of my dogs suffers from severe car anxiety and even she wags her tail and hops right in the car when she hears we are going to "daycare"!  Thank you WTD for taking such good care of my girls!

name: Tonyia D
text: My pup LOVES WE TALK DOG and so do I!! They are a very clean and doggie loving facility!! The playground is awesome!! The pups have fans, shaded area, and pools on the playground!! The indoors is very well laid out and always very clean! The staff and the owner is AWESOME!! They also offer grooming which is also GREAT!! I have done I guess everything they have to offer with my pup!! I do doggie daycare, boarding, grooming and training!!! It's great to see the doggie's dragging their owners into the daycare wagging their tails cause they are so excited to be there!! It's is all EXCEPTIONALLY OUT OF THIS WORLD at WE TALK DOG!!! If you are looking for the perfect place for your pup look no further than WE TALK DOG!!

name: L R
text: I've been using WTD several years now for the purposes of day care and boarding of 3 dogs. I use the day care irregularly sometimes with weeks passing before I need to have my dogs attend for a day or two. Regardless of how much time has passed, the staff always recognizes me and my dogs every time - greeting us all by name upon arrival. It's like having my dogs watched by a trusted family member.  My little boxer dog, Tilley, was initially timid about going and was appropriately placed with the small dog pack group even though her sister, Gunner, was in the "big dog" group. Knowing TIlley wanted to be with Gunner, WTD carefully observed Tilley and transitioned her gradually to play with the "big dogs". And on those days when the big dogs seemed really big, WTD would place TIlley back with the little dogs. My third dog, Roman, is an 80 pound VOCAL red bone coon hound. His happy howling bay can get annoying, but all staff at WTD take delight when Roman vocalizes his joy.  I like the ease of online access to schedule boarding or day care and buying multi day packages so check out is a breeze. No fumbling with wallet or payment.

name: Matthew Sensintaffar
text: I would not take my dogs there. Unkempt, Elitist, poor business practices. We called about enrolling our rescue dog in daycare and getting some training to help integrate her into the world. Our message was taken and they never called back. so I figured I would just take her down there and have a talk with these folks. I grabbed her vet papers. I had the day off so I threw on my t-shirt and flip flops since it was a hot summer day and upon arrival we were greeted by poo on the floor of the foyer and were looked up and down by the woman standing there who promptly frowned. She talked with the peson in front of me for a bit longer while studying us with that same frown on her face and after they finished their conversation asked "May I help you?". So a little back story on this dog. She is a boston terrier who we are fostering for a local rescue. She came from a puppy mill situation and she has a scar on one eye and at the point of writing this is still pretty malnourished. She is not the prettiest dog in the world but she is sweet and everyone who knows her loves her, Except this person apparently. SO, I told her what we were interested in and the best she would offer up was a piece of paper to sign up that she never actually gave me. She then launched into the fact that we would have to schedule a temperament assessment and that the next available appointment was several weeks out. I told her we had called several weeks ago and no-one called us back. She said that she had seen my message and that their trainers were "Very busy" and that they simply could not afford the time to contact me. I explained to her the situation with this dog being a rescue and that being a foster home we were not likely to have her too very long to which she simply stuff the paper back in the manilla envelope from which it came and gave me that tilted head, high pitched, insincere, "Sorry". So we left. Precious, our rescue dog, seemed to be a little down about it so I went by our local bagel shop who makes dog treats and picked us both up a little something for the rejection. All in all though, after thinking about it, I would not take any of my dogs to this place. Between the poo on the floor, the bad attitude, and the inability to return a phone call I don't know that I would trust these folks with my family. We had hoped to get this poor little dog some extra socialization and training to help her get along with her permanent home. I guess the search continues. I may send my spouse by in work garb with one of our fluffier dogs to see how she is treated just as an experiment.

name: Sarah Ball
text: GROOMING REVIEW: As of today, this was our goldendoodle's 5th groom with We Talk Dog. We have never had any problems up to this point and all groomings have been on point. I knew when we walked in and saw that our normal groomer, Jonathan, was not in that it might be a tad different groom but I did not expect what we got. We asked for our doodle to be cut to about 1/2 inch without sacrificing his curls. Everytime Johnathon would cut him he would always take time to walk him back gently and today our doodle was roughly pulled to the back, and when we picked him up he was shaved down with no curls in sight. I called to express my frustration and try to process a remedy to the problem and the receptionist was extremely defensive, condenscing, and rude. As if we were the problem. Just FYI, Johnathon has moved to start his own pet salon in ATL so they will not be providing the same services if you have been a previous customer. We will no longer be back.

name: Jim Thornton
text: Great with my dog

name: Lisa Mardis

name: Deepak Kumar
text: Good

name: lionspiritualjourney
text: This place is so nice and clean. I called ahead of time and she took my dog back immediately upon arriving. The little dog that you saw in the picture it was the one that greeted me first. Alora is the lady who assisted and Bailey's nails came out looking great.

name: Hope Russo
text: Love the Ruff House! They've been great to my babies since Fall '16 and I can't imagine anyone else taking the care that they do! We use them for day camp, boarding, and grooming and have zero complaints!

name: Danielle “PersonalitybyDanielle” Simms

The staff was also very friendly and accommodating. We fled from Irma, and they were so understanding and they took him in last notice with no problem. name: Adam Pfaff
text: Love the Ruff House and their professionalism towards caring for your animals! We have been happy to have been sending our pups to The Ruff House for day care and grooming since they opened. Our dogs always leave tired and happy, and our younger dog has made great improvements in obedience through training sessions with Hillary. Their boarding services are great as well. Highly recommend using them!

name: Jeremy Crutchfield
text: My dog Callie loves the Ruff house!! They are always very nice and professional. When I pick my dog up she is tired and happy. Their grooming service is the perfect add on to doggy day care especially when you pick your pup up with trimmed nails and clean.

name: Cäy Cäy T
text: My god mom works here and she is very good with grooming. She had been grooming for years and has always gotten compliments. The daycare is huge and your dogs make friends. You can also Adot dogs!

Our boy came back so happy,clipped and groomed and smelling sooo clean. We will defiantly use them again! Thanks girls, you all were AMAZING!

resp.text: Thank you so much for the review Bettye! I absolutely adore Angie and Tyler. I can’t wait to work more with you guys

name: Dawn Auer
text: Our two 6 month old borador puppies LOVE to train with Bobby!  They have learned so much in such a short time period.  Bobby's positive reinforcement methods have been super successful and easily carried over at home.  He is always available to answer any questions we have.  Bobby clearly loves what he does and this is very evident through his interactions with our puppies and their humans as well!!  Contact Bobby to get great tips and proven methods on how to have the most well behaved dogs!!

name: Travis wolfe
text:
Harley Bear loves Roverchase. She always starts screaming in a good way when we pull up and see the door. Ahe wants to see der fellow hairy friends. Also, Rachel, I believe that does the haircuts always does a great job. Harley bears haircut yesterday was awesome. Would not even think about sending her anywhere else. Highly recommend Roverchase.
I am not getting anything for saying this I am just a happy customer
She goes 1 or 2 times a week amd the prices. Are great. Shea tired out when i pick her up. Wish they did kiddie daycare too. J/k.

name: Jim BUTTERS
text: My great Dane and I have learned a lot since coming to RoverChase. They have taught my dog and I how to have a well behaved pet. That's something you really need with a large dog.

name: Desiree Perkins
text: Took my pup here for a few months and he seemed to love it. Came home exhausted each time as if he had a blast. As far as the friendliness of the staff, that was a hit or miss, honestly. I only interacted with one lady who I think may have been the owner that was really really sweet. Anyone else would come get my puppy from the car in the mornings, not say good morning or anything, just grab him and walk inside. I don’t know a single staff member’s name because no one ever introduced themselves to me. His very first day at daycare, he came home with scratches on his face from where he’d gotten into a fight with another dog. His second time at daycare, I got a call from one of the staff members there letting me know that he’d got bitten in the head by another dog & was asked if I wanted to come pick him up. I debated on not going back after that but decided to give it the benefit of the doubt. A few weeks later, my puppy contracts Kennel Cough from there which ultimately developed into pneumonia. As any other pet parent, I was angry because every dog is supposed to be fully vaccinated in order to attend there. $250 later, thankfully, he made a full recovery. I didn’t take him back for weeks because I was paranoid. However, I moved closer to the area and decided to give it another shot. Took him back on a Friday. A few days later, I notice he isn’t feeling well & end up having to take him to the emergency vet at 2:30 am. What have you know, Kennel Cough AGAIN. He’s been sick now for almost two weeks. Needless to say, I will not be returning to this facility. Ever.

resp.text:
Hello Desiree, thank you for reaching out to us with a review.  Our COVID Care protocols have definitely made it much more difficult for our staff to interact with our clients with conversations.  We have really missed these interactions too!  We do feel strongly that our curbside dropoff/pickup services as well as our staff wearing full PPE is in the best interest of our community, our clients, and our staff - but it has definitely left us missing those close interactions and relationship building with our clients.  I'm sorry you missed that too.  We are definitely learning how to best create relationships with our clients in the climate of COVID safety.  Your feedback will be very helpful as we continue to grow and change with these new and ever changing restrictions.

I'm also sorry to hear your pup got cough while he was participating in our services.  This particular strain of cough this year has actually made several national news stories as it has shown up all over the country.  It's been a nasty strain.  We worked very closely with our veterinary advisory team to be sure we were utilizing the absolute best practices in cleanliness and disinfectant protocols throughout our facility.  We also did our best to inform all clients honestly and openly about the outbreak.  We feel very fortunate that we were able to get it under control so quickly because of our amazing veterinary advisory team.  Just like childcare, dog daycare does pose a slightly higher risk of dogs getting upper respiratory infections and sometimes GI upset in group play.  We do our very best to inform our clients of this by having it clearly stated in several places on our General Client Agreement all clients receive and sign before their first day of daycare with us.  While we sincerely wish the bordatella vaccine required by our facility was able to protect against all cough, just like the human flu vaccine, it does not.

Again, we appreciate your feedback and wish you and your dog well and that you are able to find another facility that suits your needs.  Please let us know if we can help you with any pet care needs in the future.

name: Wendy James
text: Friendly, welcoming and professional. Highly recommend Rover Chase!

name: Chris Wilson
text: This is Jackson aka Jax. I was nervous initially about leaving him as a 12 week old puppy for daycare 3 days a week. I can say now it was the best move I ever made. I have been raising German Shepherds for over 25 years. However, my schedule had changed dramatically and I was driving 5 days a week, almost 8 hours a day. The thoughts of leaving him to himself home in a crate were worse than the fear for leaving him with someone else. He will be 1 year old June 21, 2018. He is by far the most well-rounded, sweetest shepherd I have had. Not a mean bone in his body. I had to take classes to learn what they taught him! I would do it again in a heartbeat. Thank you EVERYONE at Roverchase Academy for loving my boy!!

name: Emily Tompkins
text: April worked with me and my 9 month old pitbull mix to help with the pup getting over-excited and jumping up. The training time with April was great and we've seen a big improvement in the pup's behavior! I appreciated that April let us run a few minutes over to make sure all our questions were answered. Great service!

resp.text: Thank you so much!  April is amazing and we are always so happy when our clients get the opportunity to see her work her magic!

name: Christal Thompson
text: Amazing place for dogs! Great doggie daycare with lots of playtime & specialized playgroups to separate large & small dogs. Amazing trainers & kennel staff, boarding, grooming, & training classes. The owner, Abi, is highly trained & specialized in training pets, show dogs, & service dogs. The trainers, kennel manager, & groomer are all long term staff who are excellent at all they do. I really cannot say enough great things about Roverchase. 💜

name: Denise Evans
text: We brought our 1 year old German Shepherd to April at Roverchase. He  had been surrendered by former owner as "too much to handle," fostered, and then we adopted him.  He was basically a very excited overgrown puppy who was a constant handful to manage. In only one week, April taught him very important basic commands. She also helped him learn that making us happy is a rewarding experience, so she helped him globalize his education to other things.  She gave us lessons in the right way to give him commands and help reinforce good behavior. We are extremely impressed and so thrilled with our well behaved dog. Thank you, April and Roverchase!

name: Candace Sargent
text: They really care about keeping the dogs as happy as possible. They were so accommodating with my nervous dog Max! He seemed so much happier after staying there, as compared to our previous boarding location. With so many knowledgeable people on staff, I wouldn’t hesitate to recommend them.

name: Miles Olmsted
text: Rachel is a great groomer. Builds rapport with both pet and owner. They have great daycare no matter what size or temperment. 10 or 11 different modules of ample size are supervised very well. I recommend them highly.

name: Sonya Holt

resp.text: Thank you so much!  We loved meeting Lil’ Dude!  Thank you for trusting us with his care.

name: John Langlow
text: Very nice people who clearly love animals.  A really positive environment for your pet.  It's clean and efficient with reasonable prices.

name: John Langlow
text: Very nice people who clearly love animals.  A really positive environment for your pet.  It's clean and efficient with reasonable prices.

name: Jordan Davis
text: I was really excited to get my dog Mallard into training at Roverchase. That excitement was short lived however when I registered online for the Orientation class online for $50 only to find out it doesn’t exist. My wife and I drove 40 minutes for the class and were then told the class didn’t exist and no one was there to train. So they took our name and number for the owner to call us and get us a refund. The owner did end up calling a week later from an unknown number and left a voicemail. I have subsequently called six more times to try to get ahold of the owner. Most of the time I was told she was out and would call me. She never called. On one occasion I spoke to the manager and he was going to call me back. Never called me back. At this point I guess I’m using this as a $50 life lesson to never pay ahead of time (despite their policy that the price goes up if you pay there). We will have to find another trainer to get our dog certified with Hand in Paw because I will not take our dog here. They had multiple chances to remedy the situation and we were understanding of the issue, but the lack of customer service and failure to even call back or refund us is unacceptable.

name: Jeremy Knezek
text:
This review only describes the Puppy Class and I have no other experience with this establishment. However, I found the classes to be ridiculously unprofessional. They charge the going rate, $20 per 1 hour class session for 4 sessions. However, the classes never start on time, the instructor is rarely prepared with her materials, generally she is looking at her phone several times per lesson and disappearing into another room, and 2 of 4 classes ended early. The instructor clearly knows how to train a dog, however this place has a business model based on you dropping your dog off for several weeks and a thousand or more dollars later they train the dog for you. I have no doubt she is exceptionally effective in that environment, but these classes where you learn to train your dog yourself are over complicated, incoherent, and lack any kind of structure. I feel like mostly they are used to get you to admit you need to drop your dog off with them, because that is the only way the dog will get trained. I've had better experiences with a big box store training, and that isn't saying much. There are significantly better training places for the same money with a whole lot less agenda. Hint: look for a non-profit dog obedience and training club.

Response to the owner: First off, it's labelled a rolling class. You don't need to offer "a missed class at no extra charge", that's part of it being rolling. You show up for 4 classes, whether they are consecutive or not, and I checked ahead of time to make sure that was the case. Second, in 3 of the 4 classes there was no socialization time unless you count the period of time we all waited in the office while the instructor was running late. Ending the class early twice ensured no socialization time. You offer 14 days of board and train for $1100 and 28 days for $2100. Both of those cost more than the thousand dollars I put in my review. So yes, you offer both cheaper and more expensive options, personally I think I hit the middle pretty well with my review. I put in my review you charge the going rate. I don't dispute that. I also said the trainer knows how to train dogs, the trainer simply didn't do much to help people learn to train their own dogs in this one class. Finally, the Birmingham Obedience and Training club is a non-profit club, they just aren't a charity. I find the vast majority of your response to my review to have been very misleading.

resp.text:
Hello Jeremy,
I'm sorry you didn't enjoy your Puppy Kindergarten class with us.  I am the owner of Roverchase and you have not contacted us in your 4 week training so, until this review, I was unaware of your unhappiness.  I have called the other puppies in your class period and they have all been exceptionally pleased and have all signed up for additional group classes for continuing education, so I am a bit confused.  I would be more than happy to talk with you about your experience.  I do know that your dog missed a week of Puppy Kindergarten and we were very happy to accommodate your schedule and allow you to makeup your missed class at no additional charge.     Puppy Kindergarten is a socialization and basic manners class and not a true "training skills" course.  This is very clear in the description of our class on our website as well as the materials given in each class period.  As mentioned previously, I would be more than happy to speak with you about your experience, please feel free to call the front office at 205-332-0203 and ask for Abigail.  Also, as a note, our day-training program is our most popular program but it is hardly "thousands of dollars."  Most of our clients spend between $250-450 for four weeks of all day training where they drop their dog of several times a week each week.  This is hardly "thousands of dollars" and is, in fact, some of the best prices is town.  Our Puppy Kindergarten class is also priced competitively with "the big box store" but you are taking this class from one of the most highly experienced and certified canine behavioral consultants in the city.  As an additional note, our prices are less expensive then the Obedience Club in our town, which is not non-profit.  Birmingham does not have a non-profit training club.

name: Kelli Love
text: Enjoyed seeing the dogs didnt like idea being inside all day. Sorry wasnt shown the outside runs your facility was top notch dont get me wrong. It was clean Air conditionered and very well maintained.i meant nothing bad as it was a very nice place . i got a job and i appreciate the interview and the way they did the group interview made everyone relax  a little more. But meant no harm as you have a wonderful place

resp.text:
Hello JenKelli,
We appreciated your application for employment and wish you very well in your future endeavors as we chose to hire another individual.  Just to clarify, we do have large outdoor yards attached to our indoor play spaces.  All dogs go outside multiple times per day to play and potty and then spend the majority of their day enjoying 10,000sq ft of climate controlled indoor play space.  We even have pools outside!  It’s super fun and the best of both worlds.

name: Robert Williams
text: Friendly and knowledgeable staff... They love animals.

name: Elizabeth Straub

text:
I've had an incredible experience with Roverchase. I have found the staff to be incredibly knowledgeable and effective with training. I love their philosophy and approach. They are extremely professional but also fun.

Bringing a puppy into a home with 2 small children is no small task, so their daycare package has been a life-saver for me when I'm too worn out to wear my puppy out. They wear him out, train him, and act as advisors.

You can tell they really care about, not only the dogs, but you as a customer. It's a pleasure every time I go there, and I love supporting a local, small business that's doing great work in my own backyard.

name: Kevin Auer
text:
I have gone through Roverchase group training which was fantastic. Aidan did a great job and took time to work on things that I specifically was having trouble with when there was not a big class. I took my dog to daycare and the owner, Abigail, stated that he was having trouble and recommended a behaviorist that comes to Roverchase every Thursday and Saturday. The price was $400 dollars which I was happy to pay because I really wanted the best for Blue (my dog). We talked with the behaviorist for about an hour and that was the end of the session. The behaviorist did not really teach or show me anything that I did not already know. The behaviorist did not even see the behavior that I was having trouble with but yet she was quick to write out a treatment plan. The behaviorist did say that I would need to do private lessons with Abigail which is not included in the cost. So for $400 dollars I talked to a lady for an hour. This is a big scam and I am really troubled that Roverchase would be a part of it.

My appointment lasted 1 hour. We left right after 5 and the appointment started at 4. So go back and check your cameras again. Yes, I was happy to pay the $400 dollars which I stated previously. But I was under the impression that I would get useful information and more than just talking to a "Behaviorist" for an hour. Again, how can she, the behaviorist, tell me what is the cause and real problem without even seeing the behavior. I even emailed the behaviorist trying to get a refund because that was not what I was expecting. Not even wanting a full refund because I understand that she did take time out of her day to meet with me. But I think she can keep the $80 dollars deposit and refund the $320 since I do not need her "expertise" any longer. But she has not responded to my email which she specifically stated was the best/fastest way to communicate with her. And as far as reviews need to be left honestly and in good faith...I did that. You decided to lie on your response by saying that you checked the cameras and that I was there for a little under 2 hours. Your cameras times are off or you lied. I told you that I actually loved Roverchase. I even recommended people go to y'all which only one of them did but one is better than none. But I do still think that I was scammed.

resp.text:
Dear Mr. Auer,
I’m so surprised to read your review regarding your experience with Blue and Dr. Beihunko, Roverchase, and the chain of events you described.  I appreciate you giving me the opportunity on this public platform to respond.
Firstly, I’m so glad you were pleased with your group classes at Roverchase with our trainer Aidan.  He’s so talented and our clients just adore him.  I’ll be sure to pass on your praise.  Thank you.
To address your concerns regarding your experience with Dr. Biehunko, I will do my best to address them in an organized fashion.
-  I recommended Blue see Dr. Biehunko when Blue presented to daycare last week after a 5 month absence from Roverchase.  Prior to Blue’s absence, we had discussed at length Blue’s increase reactivity and dog related aggression and you indicated you did not want to address it with us at that time but wanted to work with it on your own.  We advised against it.  When you presented last week, Blue came for a day of daycare and was significantly worse in all behaviors.  I recommended a consultation with Alabama’s only Veterinary Behaviorist, Dr. Biehunko.  I thoroughly explained how Dr. Beihunko’s consultations worked, that they were $400 and for that price you received a 1.5-2hr consultation with her expertise and she would make a diagnosis, a treatment plan, and then have 6 months of medical management and follow up.  I was very clear with you that there was no doubt that Blue would need additional lessons with me and that it would be at additional cost.  You remarked that you felt this price was fair for her experience and expertise and made your appointment for later in the week
- I do rounds with Dr. Biehunko each day for our shared clients.  She had already been thoroughly briefed on Blue’s behavior at Roverchase the day he returned as well as my notes from his behavior in December when we last saw him.
- Your consultation with Dr. Biehunko was just barely under 2hrs.  I checked the time stamp on our cameras
- In your consultation with Dr. Biehunko we were all very surprised to hear that you insisted that Blue has received no training outside of his training at Roverchase.  In fact, you insisted this was true even when specifically questioned about this by Dr. Biehunko and the Roverchase trainers who sat in on the session with you.  As I’m sure you know, it’s extremely difficult for any doctor to communicate effectively and efficiently with a client when that client willfully withholds pertinent information from that doctor that impedes the treatment plan.  As you can see from the attached screen shots, not only has Blue been in training with another trainer, but it was for the very issue he was presenting for.
- Finally, since your consultation was just over 72 hours ago, and we are very clear that treatment plans can take 2-4 weeks to become effective, it’s hard to understand how you can already be so unhappy with your results.
I certainly believe that pet owners are allowed to train and handle their pets as they see fit and that there are many fits available for many different preferences.  However, I hope we can both agree that reviews need to be left honestly and in good faith and this one has some glaring issues.  I hope, in light of this, and in light of you many months of happiness with Roverchase, you will consider removing it.  We certainly wish you and Blue only the very best and much success in all of your endeavors.

Best wishes,

Abigail Witthauer
Roverchase

name: Jordan Wakefield
text: DO NOT TAKE YOUR DOG HERE!!!! If I could give them negative stars I would. I took my Australian Shepherd here because they said they would help her with her people aggression issues. All they did was put her on medication that literally made her go crazy and she was even worse on the meds than off. And they told me to lock my dog in a room and never let her around anybody. That her best hope was for her to learn to wear a muzzle, that she would ever be able to be around people. When I tried to call for an appointment I never got a call back from them and I called and called for 3 weeks. It's been well over 2 months now and still haven't heard from them. Took my dog to Dale at Just Happy Hounds in Birmingham and she is a new dog. Completely off meds she never needed to be on and her aggression is under control. She absolutely loves 3 of the workers there and runs up to them to be petted. All I needed was someone to actually tell me what to do to help my dog. Not someone that just stuck her on meds so she would be too doped up to do anything. I have heard absolutely awful things about the people that work there from past owners that brought their dogs there. Please don't take your dogs there. They will not help them if they have a major issue that needs to be handled.

name: Pavlov Skinner
text:
As a two year employee of Roverchase, first as a kennel staff member and now as Head Training Intern as a training intern, I am a general witness to the management of the facility and dogs.  I can speak to the unending care this facility provides for your dogs. Our facility is an industry leader in the Southeast. With a low dog per yard Ratio, large staff per dog Ratio, FULL day care and boarding (meaning your dog is playing all day and never gets put up except for a 30 minute lunch and bedtime at 6:30pm if boarding, we have strict adherence to the humane and ethical treatment of animals, dog temperament evaluations to allow access to the facility, and two full time vet techs.  You can trust that roverchase has your dogs safety, happiness, and wellbeing at the top of their list of priorities. The training times, schedules, and criteria are strictly followed, and you will love the experience, knowledge, and end result of our many training options.  I would love to give you a tour anytime and show you the beautiful facility and explain to you all the education and care that goes into the practices and procedures surrounding your dogs each and every day at Roverchase!

-Aidan Nicholas

name: Diane Rovere
text: Words cannot adequately describe our total gratitude to Brenden for training our Belgian Malinois as a 2-week train and board.   Before the training Kona had started acting very aggressive towards me and had even pinned me against our fence snapping and biting at me.  That was when my husband and I knew we couldn’t keep him even though we loved him so much.  We contacted a police department and the FBI to see if either organization would take him.  Fortunately the wife of the FBI agent told us we should call Off Leash K9 and get Kona trained.  The 2-week train and board was an absolute game changer!  Brenden posted videos on drop box of the training where we could watch Kona’s progress.  It was so obvious to watch that Brenden is an expert at training and knows how to train to get the behavior he wants.  Kona has been home now for about six weeks and we are definitely experiencing a total change.  He has not acted aggressive a single time since he has been home, he comes when called, goes to place and stays there until released, and basically just responds to the commands he was taught.  We could not be more pleased with Brenden and Off Leash K9 and highly recommend them to anyone wanting to take their puppy’s behavior to the next level.  They are awesome and THE go-to place for training!

resp.text: Thank your Mrs. Rovere for the amazing words. We are very happy to hear that Kona is doing so well for you know. We miss his sweet face.

name: Dana Judge
text: Every interaction I had with the awesome people at Off-Leash Huntsville, from the initial inquiry through the end of the 2 week board and train, was absolutely professional. When I dropped my dogs off, I was more than a little skeptical that Brenden would be able to accomplish all he said he could given how overly enthusiastic and strong my dogs were. Well, Brenden more than delivered on his claims.  The dogs learned all the basic commands plus 2 advanced commands. They demonstrated excellent impulse control (which they had next to none prior to this training). Brenden is calm, patient, and methodical in working with the dogs. He is excellent at problem solving.  Additionally, it is apparent that he enjoys what he does, and the dogs love him.  When I came to pick up the dogs, Brenden spent extra time with me, making sure I was comfortable handling the dogs. I could go on and on. The is a first rate training program, and Brenden is a first rate trainer.

name: Natalie Richter
text: I don't know where to begin when it comes to explaining how wonderful Off the Leash HSV is - Ciara is a dog whisperer but more importantly a Yorkie Whisperer! It turns out they were suffering from Litter Mate Syndrome and that's why they basically went rogue on me every time I attempted to work with them.  Now they walk on the leash, off the leash, sit, lay down, place, etc.  It's unbelievable.  I was so frustrated with them and now they are so well behaved it has totally changed the dynamic in the house.  Ciara and her staff are so  knowledgeable - not just in training but in dog behaviors.  And her patience not only with the dogs but with me is remarkable.  She truly changed the quality of my dogs' life as well as mine.  If I could give them 10 stars I would because they are truly off the chart when it comes to their knowledge and training.

name: kj wilson
text: Ciara was the trainer for our dog, Alfie, who was adopted from a shelter and came with no manners. He excelled at leash pulling, counter and table cruising, had no impulse control and needed a high-quality education. Ciara was able to supply that and he is now a joy to be around! His manners are impeccable, walking him is an absolute pleasure, and the countertops and tabletops are now safe. She also discovered that he had a severe lack of confidence and did a lot of self-confidence building with him.  She taught me what to look for in his body language when he is getting stressed and how to help him work through that stress in a safe and healthy manner. Even after getting him home, Ciara and I are still in touch and she is answering questions and giving suggestions when I sent her updates. Ciara and her staff truly care about the dogs in their care, and the facility has always been absolutely spotless every time I've been there. The property that they train on is absolutely gorgeous, as well! I highly recommend Ciara and her facility to anyone who is looking for either a two-week board and train program or even just obedience classes. You will be amazed at what your dog will learn!

resp.text: Thank you Mrs. Wilson for the amazing review. We strive to have this as an end goal for every client that comes to us. Alfie was a great student and and even more amazing dog to work with. Thank you for entrusting him with me.
